description:
Hole in the wall place with great pastries and cakes. Was not planning on getting a pastry but after one look at the displays I knew I had to stop by.
Selection is very large but tables and seats are only a few. So consider taking home!!!
Canolli are awesome and so are other layered cakes. 
One down side to Mara's is the price. 2 teas with two cakes will run you about $20.
author: Risto K.

description:
Drop by is you are around!

North Beach offers many good Cafe options and Mara is one of them. I am not big on pastry, but I love my coffee and Mara's staff make very good coffee drinks. With that said, if you love your pastries, you will get to chose from a long and impressive list. There are paper-thin laces, chocolate-dipped macaroons, pinwheels filled with strawberry jam, Biscottis full of sliced almonds, madeleines, meringues and more.

Mara's Italian Pastry is right on Columbus avenue, so if you find a seat out side, you will get to drink your coffee and bite on your pastry while you are crowd watching.
author: Afshin A.

description:
Let me start by saying the Cannoli's were incredible! It was my first time trying one, mainly cause I wanted to wait to be in a little Italy somewhere. With that said, I have nothing to compare it too in regards to quality & price. Here's how our experience went....

As we strolled down Columbus on our tour of Little Italy, we stumbled across Mara's. We walked in to a few people sitting & talking, a few men & a young lady that seemed to be doing homework. We walked up to an empty counter and looked over the menu, we didn't see any prices on the pastries which was odd. One of the gentlemen gestured to the young lady to help us in which she replied, no. Lol.. all good, like I said she looked busy. I'm guessing she was the owners daughter, but the gentleman ended up helping us. 

We ordered two Cannoli's & two Lattes which came out to $20 ... as mentioned above, not sure if Cannoli's usually go for over $5 but it seemed a little much for a single pastry. The Lattes were good and strong, I ended up drinking mine & half of the wifeys.

Cannoli & Latte - 5
Price - 3
Customer Service - 1
author: Raul E.

description: I chanced upon this little gem as I was on my way to fisherman's wharf. What a quaint little cafe! They had different sweets in jars , desserts and gelato with tables to sit down so you can enjoy your delicious purchases. I had the amaretto gelato which was delicious although a very small cup that i ordered cost $3.75 which I thought was a bit much. I wanted to get the berry cheesecake but it was like $7 which I thought was also exorbitant for a bit size, that's why I deducted one star.
author: Natalie Y.

description:
A bakery and gelateria of a certain traditional, old-school North Beach variety. The gelato is decent enough, as are the pastries and baked goods, and - bless them - they're open quite early in the mornings (7am) until quite late (at least 10.30pm) every day of the week. 

But there was something just quite off-putting about the "so what do you want?" attitude of the servers here in the evenings. I'd actually come here looking for the gelato offerings at the deli next door and, after being greeted in such as surly way and having already made my purchase, just kicked myself for not looking closely at the store names and street numbers.
author: Vincent L.

description: Solid old school authentic Italian Coffee and deserts. Great Cannolis! Will visit again next time I'm in town
author: Mohamed A.

description:
Picked up a no frills Cannoli here for $4 and some change and while it was good it was not any better or worse than some of the other places in North Beach to me that sells Cannoli's . 

Man behind the counter wasn't the friendliest fellow but he answered my question and was cool.
author: Rod M.

description:
I almost didn't go here cuz of all the reviews saying the service was bad but my experience couldn't have been the opposite. We were helped by the owner who couldn't have been sweeter and I watched him and a younger gentleman (son?) help others as we were seated enjoying our treats. I never saw him be anything but helpful and friendly.  

As for the food, the cannoli's were sinful! The filling was delicious and you could tell it was made fresh. We also loved our coffee and tea here too. This little shop just has such an authentic feel which comes through in the food for sure.  

I'd definitely recommend you pop by Mara's if you're in North Beach and looking for an Italian treat. :)
author: Alma P.

description:
AN ABSOLUTELY MUST DO! DELICIOUS ITALIAN PASTRIES & Cappuccino & Bakery Style Pizza. Located in the Little Italy section of San Francisco called North Beach. The most popular items in here are their CANNOLIS & Their PIZZA. Their Cannolis are Classic Ricotta DELICIOUSSSS! There is a sign in the window that states Voted Best Cannolis for 42 Years by Grandma. LOL! You got to love a place with a little sense of humor tooting their own horn. Grandma says We're The Best! Their Pizza is also Great & their Cappuccinos. They also serve Gelato here. They have table & chairs inside & outside this little Italian cafe. This is a great people watching spot.  
It used to be, you had to have mega bucks & be really rich to have the Good Life, not anymore. The Game has changed. You've been Upgraded. Now You Can 
Live Like a King on a Limited Budget!
author: Stephen Z.

description: So this is my favorite spot! I seriously came to San Francisco just for their cannolis, no joke drove the 30+ minute drive and paid the tolls just for the best cannolis! I tell everyone to stop here for them. A tad pricey, but it's the city and they are really really good. The shells are never soft, the filling is just so creamy. I've had several cannolis where people make them with cream cheese and they are nasty. Not here, they are the best here! If your in the area and looking for some really good pastries stop here.
author: Nicolette C.

description:
I'm so embarrassed to think that visitors to our beautiful city would experience such poor service.  As many other reviewers have written, the contempt with which you're met is palpable.  
No smile. 
No hello. 
No gratitude that you have decided to spend your money here instead of all of the other bakeries you could have selected.
However--gotta be fair:
The latte was excellent!
The cannolo was excellent! (singular noun but rarely used)
author: Thomas D.

description:
I like Mara's pastry. The cannoli are crisp. The cake is classic. The fritters are the best. Seriously. 

What I hate about them is they are dirty. The counter staff will touch their face or Cigarettes or money with their hands and then touch your food. Ew. Also they don't care about the integrity of their food once it leaves their place because they will mash it in a box. See photos. You try to get a nice piece of cake for your mom and you end up with a frosted hot mess because they mashed it in the box. 

They are rude chain never cheery chain smoking bigots as well. Always a pleasure to here them spew vitriol about the Arminians next door. They make me feel like it's an inconvenience for them to get up from their coffee and conversation to come and serve. 

And there is the persistent fly vortex. None of the other stores have a vortex of flies. Ew ew ew. 

But the fritters are that good.
author: Kitten M.

description:
Mara's used to be really good...now it is pretty mediocre...and I am being kind.

The help was pretty bad: blabbing at the top of their  lungs to another employee was really annoying

Pastries were really overpriced and poorly made. Tiramisu was watery and old. Cheesecake was flavorless. Cannoli was fine but tasted like a pre-made shell with basic filling ( even an idiot like me could make that!!). Three items $20  

North Beach has sort of gone down hill for a long time and Mara is a prime example of that!
author: David G.

description:
We come here for a cannoli every time we're in SF! Its got a ton of other pastries too, but its a must go
To spot every single trip!
author: Vanessa B.

description:
OVERPRICED!

Cannoli's we're surprisingly decent.  Their not NYC Cannoli's... but they will do when you've got the craving.

The thumbprint jelly cookie was dry and lacked flavor.

Tiramisu was okay.  Something wasn't quite right.  Maybe there was too much alcohol aftertaste.  Can't quite put my finger on it.

Lastly, and most disappointingly, the giant cheese danish tasted like lemon.  Typically these danishes have an almond flavor associated with them, but not this one.  Tossed it in the trash.  Wish I knew before I purchased it.  Bummer.
author: Lea B.

description: This place reminds me of the semester I spent in Italy. It has a mom & pop shop feel. My coworker from NY said this place sells rainbow cookies so I had to try them. They were okay! It's more like cake with fudge in btwn the layers. They're a $1 each which I thought was kinda pricey. They also have authentic pizza and other Italian pastries like cannoli. Definitely will be back to try more.
author: Jazmine S.

description: Went here for an after-dinner coffee and biscotti and had a terrible experience. The woman behind the counter was uninviting and mean. I paid $8.20 for a small serve-yourself coffee and TWO biscottis. I walk away thinking, "there must be a mistake.... $8.20 for a small coffee and two biscottis".... what an absolute joke. The coffee was watered down and the biscotti was bland. I will never come here again - total tourist trap and an absolute rip-off.
author: Tyler C.

description:
EVERYTHING! Everything was absolutely delicious. I was craving a few sweet things after a delicious Italian dinner a couple of blocks down, and sure enough, as soon as I saw the sweets through the window, I could not just walk by - I had to stop in! (sound familiar!?) 

I ended up getting a canolli, (obviously!), a leaf cookie with chocolate on it (not quite sure what it's called), a pizelle waffle, and a couple of other cookies! They also have plastic wrapped Christmas cookies for the season, so that was a nice touch (not sure if they were also made inhouse).

If you want gelato, I would definitely suggest taking a look at their selection. It was absolutely freezing outside, so I wasn't able to order some ice cream, but their Chocolate gelato looked DELICIOUS. Such a rich chocolate! Would love to hear how it was!

The line moved rather quickly and the service was perfect. They were quite patient, given all of the selections that I had to choose from and ended up purchasing. I will definitely be back when I'm in the area! Could be a great place to get a bunch of sweet treats for the office too!
author: Crystal C.

description:
one tea, one coffee, one cannoli and one Tiramisu $20.89! Didn't get any receipt. There was no menu or price tag. 

The guy who was woking there was rude and impatient. I'm guessing he is business order. ( or his family) doesn't use any gloves. Anyway his customer service was uglier than their cannoli.Their cannoli was awful & old. I'd be happy if their cannoli was for this year.Tiramisu was good and delicious. 

I recommend to not go there, you can find better place just 100 feet after intersection but if you go make sure you play safe. Tiramisu! that's it. Don't try to be creative or anything. They're not fresh. 

One star for their good Tiramisu.
author: Kashi E.

description:
I'm visiting from L.A. and it was big deal to splurge on cannoli calories. And choosing a spot to give your business (whether big or small)  is kind of a big deal.  
When I ordered my desert and cappuccino from the gentlemen who worked there you'd think he resented working/owning it. I don't think I've encountered a more rude person I did business with. His attitude really took away from the experience. 

It is an old fashioned and cute place but I would never go back.
author: Jill T.

description:
While venturing through North Beach looking for a place to have lunch, we walked by Mara's. Flaky pastries proudly on display caught my attention and I made sure to come back after lunch to pick something up. The inside is quite small, just a counter with 2 employees; one barista, the other helps with the pastries and doubles as a cashier. 

What caught my eye was a bear claw ( I know, not really screaming authentic Italian here ) and a rasberry ring. Also got few small cookies (about one bite each) The bear claw was surprisingly dull, as in.. even though they were generous with the almond paste filling, it was dry and very mildly sweet. I can easily forget what I was eating. The rasberry ring was much better, with its flaky shell that's full of rasberry jam swirled into the twisted dough. I'd get this again. 

Being in a tourist area, I expected to pay a bit more. But perhaps living in SoCal for many years has gotten me used to reasonable prices. Prices for the items were not posted anywhere. So 2 pastries and 3 tiny cookies that can be mistaken for crumbs came out to be $11. No biggie, but what got me annoyed and prompted me to give this place a 1 star is the service. 

The lady that helped me acted like she just found out her husband left her for a young bimbo. Very impatient and did not seem like she had any interest in helping me, even though she seemed fine with the group in front of me. No eye contact, no words exchanged besides "what do you want?" I charged it on my card and when I asked for a receipt, she pounded on the keys, ripped the receipt off the machine and handed it to me while showing me what appears to be an eye roll. I bit my tongue from chewing her out in front of a room full of tourists ( and my friends ) 

My thoughts were " If you're the owner, you best take your ass in the back and not face the public, and if you're not, you should be fired on the spot and go check into therapy. " 

I quickly found out other bakeries throughout North Beach has the same rasberry ring, so there's absolutely no reason for me to come back.
author: James L.

description: Fabulous cannoli, biscotti, and gelato. Came back twice during our visit for dessert. Best cannolis I have had. Go try them!
author: Yael G.

description:
I got the tiramisu as I did the first time I went here. Side note, this is one of the places my boyfriend took me to 2.5years ago when we first met. It brought back memories and it made me nostalgic for a bit. 

We buy a couple things to have there and a few things boxed up togo. The customer service was really nice. The guy was super patient with us as we took up the entire counter with 4 adults and a child with a large stroller. They were also maybe 30mins to closing. SORRY!! I try not to be one of those last minute customers but it's just too good to skip out on. Especially on this special double date. This place definitely made my night.
author: Kimm H.

description:
Mara's Italian Pastry

I've been here about two times in the past making this my third trip. When I come to Little Italy, I think about inclusion and family. I remember this place being filled with baked goodies and nice locals sitting down being comfortable reading their newspapers. My experience here like the second time was not very friendly. I felt like I was wasting the shopkeeper's time while he charged my almost $3 for a tiny cannoli. I was a bit skeptical coming back here and should've went with my hunch.

The cannoli was tiny, creme was okay while I found one chocolate chip in my vanilla one. The crust was not nice and felt like it was sitting out for a while. Maybe the next person will have better luck than I.
author: Liza H.

description:
I gotta say Mara's display window of delectable desserts was the draw that pulled us three into her arms while spending an evening in North Beach, SF! The gelato was very good but the pastry (especially the canoli) which is proclaimed to be the best - well, not to be too overly critical here, I'd say the canoli cream in Italy is far better. There are lots of great looking desserts to select from, so not time there will be more to explore.

The shoppe is tiny so seating is challenging, but they have a few tables out front which does help elevate the crowd inside. The staff was very helpful and attentive for sure!
author: Joe R.

description:
A trip to San Francisco is never complete without a trip to Little Italy.  I wanted to pick up some treats to take home and stopped by Mara's because the pics on Yelp looked really good.  They guy behind the counter was not helpful at all.  He didn't great us when we came in and I had to repeat myself several times to get my questions answered.  He was very distracted by someone getting a ticket outside the store.  
We got one cannoli and left.  It was ok.
author: D D.

description: Mara's is a small little place located in the middle of Little Italy SF. There is a big glass window and the pastries are displayed proudly. They are begging you to come in and try some. I went here twice during my recent visit in SF. The first time, I ordered some cannoli and some gelato. The cannoli was pretty good and a decent size. The pistachio and mint chip gelato was flavorful and seemed fresh. The cannoli was $4.95 for one, which was kind of outrageous. They were tasty, but not worth $5. The second time I went here, I ordered some more cannoli and some little cookies. Four small cookies were $3. The cookies and cannoli were tasty, but the prices hit my wallet hard. When in Little Italy, you should definitely try a cannoli from this place. They are great, but the prices are a drawback and make me reluctant to return.
author: Ismael P.

description:
Not good! Tried a double mocha and not even close to Pucchinis! The Macaroons were sub par! 

And really?!!!! No bathrooms for Customers!! That's shitty!
author: Rod W.

description: Maybe the biggest problem was that this place was highly recommended. But it was a big disappointment. My creme brûlée had soggy sugar on top, and I couldn't get past the texture to determine whether or not I even liked the flavor. Then I also got a cannoli that had a grainy filling. While we were looking at the goods, we also couldn't help but notice a lot of the food was from Costco (lemon cakes, chocolate cakes, Lofthouse sugar cookies). So save the money and get gelato from the place next door. My friend went there, and I sat in jealousy while she ate.
author: Kristin M.

description:
So much could be said about Mara's. It's a quaint bakery with old school Italian charm and piles of traditional pastries that definitely don't hold back when it comes to carbs. Their display window is the best hook; it catches the eye of anyone walking by, whether you're searching for something to nosh on or not. It's always filled with freshly-baked sweet and savory pastries, like: cream cheese danishes, croissants, bear claws, turnovers, pizza breads, rings, orejas, cannolis - you name it! It definitely catches my eye. That's actually what got me through these doors a few years back. I can't resist sweets and there's way more inside. They have an expanse of other Italian pastries that you may not even be familiar with but are definitely worth the try as well as a slew of cookies and biscotti of all flavors. 

I've had a few of their pastries, which are great, but I've been stuck on this one pastry the last few visits and I can't get enough. Sadly I don't know what it's called and I just point it out every time. It's a flaky pastry with a ridiculous amount of custard inside that pours out almost like a pot belly and the whole thing is covered in translucent sugary glaze. My friend ordered something that was a bit funny in appearance but the owner, in his Italian accent, assured us was called a "mushroom". It looked like a breadstick attached to a profiterole. A flaky pastry exterior with a thick chocolate and rum center. Wow! You could actually taste the alcohol which complimented the chocolate perfectly. I think these two are my favorites. 

While everything is delicious and visually appealing, a word of warning: you will order more than you can eat. It's guaranteed. Which is fine! Take one or two more for the road. Happy eating ~
author: Jonnathan B.

description: Delicious pastries and espresso, a great little place to stop at when walking around in little Italy. I had a fantastic cannoli and cappuccino, I'll defined be back.
author: Laney M.

description: Last night I got two Biscotti, one regular cannoli and a raspberry ring pastry and realized this morning I was charged $16.20. I thought it was around $10 max but apparently someone added on somehow when it went through my bank. Watch out to overcharges here. Scam alert! We even got it to go so there was no eat in tax. Wtf $16.20?!
author: Erin H.

description: I can say that it's the best canoli in San Francisco and profiterole are also good. Ricotta is fresh and the biscuit also. But the first time it was not so expensive as I bought the second time for one canoli and one profiteroles:11,75$(pictures of the ticket and no details). I said them that the first time, last week, I took only one canoli it was for 2,50$ and after one week they multiply by 2 their prices or it was just something for me ?!
author: Marie-Claire L.

description: After a great dinner. The best thing to do is to take a little walk to North Beach and hit Mara's for late night dessert. You won't be able to choose from the delicious assortments of Italian pastries. The lemonicello cake is highly recommended and the conoli are not bad.  Stella's down the block has conolis that are slightly larger and a bit sweeter, but these aren't  bad if you go earlier in the day. The custard Eclair could use a little more custard.
author: Leanh E.

description: We ordered coffee and a slice of cheescake. Service was impatiant and rude. Cheesecake tasted badly, like it was old. We mentioned that to the guy and he offered another slice, which we obviously refuesed. We finished the coffee and left the cake almost untouched.
author: Noa B.

description:
I love Mara's Italian Pastry in North Beach and am so happy to have found it!  

We stopped at two other cafes before this one but never stayed. Now we know why! 

Mara's is the real deal. Everyone is speaking Italian, except for the barista,she is speaking Spanish, but no matter, Mara's is all Italiano!

I had an almond milk latte and my man had a capuccino. They have biscotti's as far as the eye can see...

We immediately succumbed to its power. We take a seat outside at a round little table with a view of the TA building. My man is cooing, "awwww those cannolis look good baby!"  We've been watching our weight, yes, collectively, so I tell him absolutely no... Unless he really wants it. (I will make a great parent one day.) 

My man points to a crappy-need-to-be-replaced sign in the window that boasts their cannoli's were voted the best for 42 years running. 

At this point I lose my man, poof!, he is inside, he comes back with a cannoli, and damn that is a good cannoli. If this cannoli had been on the set of The Godfather there would have been no cannoli to take.  Wow, this pastry is special, and I dare say it might just be the best cannoli I've ever eaten. We believe that crappy sign, 100 percent!
author: Monica E.

description: 4/5 stars because we tried two different things and only liked one....the cannoli! The Napoleon wasn't great but the cannoli was so delicious it made up for the Napoleon.
author: Mina T.

description:
This was a cute little Italian bakery in Northbeach. Hubby and I hanged out before our comedy show.

We ordered an Americano and a Latte.  Since it's an Italian coffee house, the coffee is pretty small.  There are a variety of pastries from cannolis, cheesecake, cookies, tiramisu, pecan pie, etc.

I had the tiramisu and as you slice into it, you can see the liquid oozing out of the cake- that was good! My husband had the pecan pie. Since we had sweets our lavazza coffees did not need any sweetener.

The place was cute and nice to sit and chat over coffee
author: Melinda R.

description: Go somewhere else. The pastries here are mediocre at best, which is surprising given the presentation. We had an eclair and nougat. Both left a lot to be desired- perhaps they just weren't fresh. The service was just as bad. One woman was sitting down at a table and never got up to help us.
author: Lisa T.

description: The Tiramisu and Cannoli were very tasty. We ordered a latte and a mocha which needed to be heated up longer. The younger guy working the cafe wasnt too friendly and a little hostile but the elderly man behind the counter with him was funny and happy which made up for the cashiers attitude.  Loved the seating outside of the cafe and the pastries were  yummy.
author: Sarah C.

description: I have been coming here for almost 20yrs to get the best chocolate croissants in the city but I have noticed an all too familiar tactic in the last two years that has led me to believe this place isn't the same anymore. 2yrs ago I stopped coming here because they started using too much sugar and this year I went back because I missed them, and nobody else makes them like this, but they started making them smaller...a cheapening of ingredients and reducing the portion size...just terrible and just too obvious that they stopped caring about what we think of how their stuff tastes...trumps world smh
author: Chris G.

description: Absolutely decadent deserts!! This is a great little place for coffee and desert after a nice dinner out or just to slay the sweet tooth.
author: Bodie L.

description:
Yum! Big assortment & all delicious . 
" You cannoli live once " lol! 
So indulge in all the pastries
author: Jo C.

description:
Food: Tried a cannoli with a chocolate dipped end. The cheese filling was creamy, rich, not overly sweet, and delicious. The pastry was perfect, not stale as some can be. 

Ambiance: Cute little cafe with a few tables. Each table only seats a few people so not an ideal space for a large group. The displays of desserts were impressive, both facing the street and inside. 

Service: This is why I docked a couple stars. No one greeted us or asked us if they could help us. There were a few men seated at a table talking and after a bit, one eventually got up and stood behind the counter, so we knew he was the employee. After asking a question about what was in one of the pastries, he seemed so annoyed and unhappy, I didn't ask any more questions. I just picked something I recognized and we left.
author: Susan G.

description:
2.5 stars, i'm on the fence.
I was walking thru the neighborhood and was looking for cannolis at 8pm so i walked in and bought 2 cannolis.  

Since there's no prices on the pastries, I will inform.  
The register ran up $9.90 for two cannolis.
my fault for not asking first, but who'd guess 4.95 for one cannoli.

Now i'm in the camp of- even a bad cannoli is still very edible.
I bought one regular and one chocolate dipped.  the chocolate was crispier, maybe it was made more recent.I scarfed down both of them , they tasted ok/alright.  The cream inside is like slight grainy cream cheese type.  i only read their yelp reviews afterward, ohhh now i know why the guy who rang up my order had no smile, you would guess getting 4.95 for a cannoli would be like laughing all the way to the bank..
author: hugh L.

description:
The tiramisu was disgusting, because there was wet, soppy, tasteless cake sponge in it. Does NOT taste like coffee...maybe cheap office coffee that's cold. Yes I know that tiramisu is supposed to be served cold, but in the case of this cake the coldness just made the taste and texture of the cake more disturbing. 

The cannoli: tasted a LOT like thick, lumpy cream cheese. Don't know if cannoli is supposed to taste this way, but I didn't like this. The "chocolate" cannoli DOES NOT TASTE LIKE CHOCOLATE. 

The price for 2 cannoli and a tiramisu is $16. With the quality, not worth it. Sigh.

The cherry on the top is when we asked one of the staff to clear a table, he rudely told us that "we could've sat at a clean table" as he cleared the coffee cups. The other tables were full when we sat down! His comment made me feel so embarrassed and unwelcome.
author: Anita Y.

description: I've been to Mara's twice in the past year and both times I was given some stank-ass attitude by the Latinas manning the register. How dare I interrupt their conversation to order some day-old tasting pastries! The only thing that stopped them from blatantly rolling their eyes at me was probably my own Resting Bitch Face. I don't scare easy, ladies. However, don't count on me buying from here again because there are handfuls of better Italian bakeries in this vicinity that serve meringues, chocolate chip cookies, & those almond cookies with a cherry in the middle that taste a million times better because they don't come with unwarranted cattiness. I'll wave as I skip past on my way to another bakery!
author: Fancypants X.

description:
I can't imagine walking down this stretch of Columbus Avenue without seeing Mara's picture window filled w pastries.  Their neighboring businesses have come & gone, but Mara's hasn't moved or changed in decades.  It is this contributing continuity that helps make up the strongest leg this neighborhood is still standing on.  

Like all bakeries, Mara's has its strengths & its weaknesses.  Their biggest strength is their cannoli.  And their weakness is the sometimes spotty service.

The cannoli is legit, even according to pure Italian standards.  Having cannoli w your coffee here is an authentic experience...from the first, ricotta filled bite, to the nondescript, card-room like interior.  This isn't a heavily ornamented, high end space in pac heights.  It's an old school NB bakery.  They expect the pastries to speak for themselves.

The honorable mention has to go to the raspberry ring.  It has never been my thing personally, but they basically have a cult following.  I have to say they are pretty fantastic when they're right out of the oven, or heated up.

North Beach is still high on community & low on gentrification.  As a result, there are the old shops that can be standoffish towards folks they don't know.  Good business?  Certainly not.  But, it's a small bark with no bite.  And it is not at all personal.  Take it as the idiosyncrasy that it is.

I have to give a shout out to Vince, who didn't mind chatting w me about a particular Italian cookie that used to be available at Victoria.  Vince was genuinely interested & helpful.  Props.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Randomly bumped into this place because my friends and I were looking for a dessert place. We got there and there are three small tables inside and one table was full and the other had a bunch of dirty dishes still there. 

There were two people working at the time so I wonder why they didn't pick it up. Moving on, I got the pistachio gelato - was yum! And added espresso to it. Double yum. 

There is no restroom here FYI. 

It was a nice place to stumble upon.
author: Nikita B.

description:
This is an authentic italian pastry cafe, where even the staff spoke Italian.

We had the gelato which was delicious and the although we did not try them yet, the pastry looked amazing. 

I will hopefully be going back before I leave San Fran for some of those authentic looking italian pastry.
author: Eric C.

description: Really bad service. We ordered the crème brûlée which was full of sugar, watery, and without the caramelized sugar top and to top it all I was charged one and a half dollars for using my credit card to pay. Really bad experience and pathetic service. The server had a frown on his face the whole time and looked as if he was forced to serve us. I would recommend to anyone planning to go here to check out the café next-door which has much better tasting desserts and infinitely better service.
author: Suyog S.

description: Best pastries/desserts. Authentic canollies and made the correct way! This is located I. North beach and there is so much to walk to. Worth taking a quick drive/walk to!
author: Brittany D.

description:
This place is small.
My friends tried the tiramisu and chocolate cream puff.
Looks good but didnt try it.
I got the coffee and it was okay.
The thing that makes me to rate 3 stars for this place is because the service was... uh. Not friendly, but not mediocre. Just that, the guy who served us looked so lazy. He spilled my friend's hot chocolate.
author: Candice L.

description:
First of all, I hate leaving these types of reviews and always hesitate to do so. But come on, this business needs to try harder and improve what they're doing wrong.

We were looking for dessert after dinner at Sodini's. A waitress there had recommended Mara since Sodini's does not serve dessert.

The front of the shop looks good. Full of Italian pastries, canolies, pastries of different kinds, just like in Italy. 

We decided to get an assortment of pastries including a chocolate eclair filled with custard, tiramisu, soft Italian Turron and a crunchy chocolate roll. Even though the window display looks amazing, all the pastries tasted so old! They most definitely had been sitting there for days and I should have checked Yelp before purchasing these.

We were charged $30 for these old pastries. It was so disappointing to taste. The tiramisu was soggy & had been there for a while as well. 

The two ladies other reviewers mention were still there - one was sitting at one of the tables that is supposed to be for customers, the other one at the counter. They were both talking in Spanish to each other when we were asking them questions about the pastries.

A real tourist trap and such a waste of calories - skip it!!
author: Leslie S.

description:
THIS PLACE HAS COCKROACHES. STAY AWAY.

My friends and I stopped in here yesterday after brunch for a quick cup of coffee.  I ordered a double cappuccino and it was pretty bad. The beans tasted burnt and there was WAY too much foam. That alone does not earn a 1 star review however.

As we were getting up, I almost stepped on a HUGE cockroach. This is clearly gross and shows unsanitary conditions. I seriously wonder whether this business even cares or if they just assume tourists will stop in. Overall, STAY AWAY. I don't care if their pastries are good or not.
author: Carrie W.

description:
Two stars for the pastry and the fact that they now take visa and MasterCard - a cannoli and a raspberry ring cost $9.45. The cannoli is not as good as my Sicilian grandmother used to make. But unless you're Italian, you won't know the difference. Go to Stella's Pastry or Victoria Pastry for REAL ITALIAN pastry. 

Why I will NEVER return...... Every time I've come to this place, I'm always having to order from the same scowled faced Hispanic women behind the counter that is always speaking in Spanish LOUDLY and turns to look at us with the raised eyebrows as if we're interrupting them! If they were speaking Italian, German, French, it doesn't matter, it's the attitude they display toward a customer. And it's with every customer that comes in! 

This place will never change if people continue to spend their money here! Take your business to  Stellas or Victoria's Pastry. Italians are generally friendly,  happy people....I don't know who the owner is, but he is definitely not Italian. 

The owner obviously gives his employees the approval to act this way - with customers!! If he doesn't care enough to hire employees who can give service with a smile and who enjoy dealing with the public, why do you want to give him your money? So, future customers, don't have you're day or night ruined by being treated in a rude manner....take your business to Stella's or Victoria's Pastry & be greeted with authentic smiles and authentic Italian pastries! Did I mention perfect coffee/cappuccino/espresso....
author: Cherlyn S.

description:
"Leave the gun. Take the cannoli" 
The Godfather

This place is really cool. The shop is not pretty, but the tons of pastries filling the window and counter really make it special. 
The cannoli were great, as were all the pastries we tried. The service would have been better suited to NYC then San Francisco, and they seemed to cater more to the Italian locals then us touristy type.
author: Lou G.

description: I went there today, the window was very appetizing.... I went in and ordered $36 worth of pastries from the gentleman. The workers attitude was so lousy that it extended itself to the taste of the food. I wish I NEVER stopped to go inside.
author: Yelp-a-holi C.

description: Fell in love with the look of this place in little Italy. I guess I should have saved my money and just enjoyed the look of it. I ordered a chocolate dipped cream filled horn. Found the pastry stale and lacking any good flavor. The other half got tiramisu and loved it. The hot chocolate was good, not great. The server seemed irritated to take our order. Pictures are pretty though
author: Jessa Y.

description:
Stopped in here for a quick espresso and pastry and the place absolutely sucked! 

Like many people have mentioned, the service absolutely sucks. This guy couldn't care less that we were in the cafe and was very bothered to help us out. This is not the Italian way! We even mentioned that we are Italian thinking he would perk up, no! Nothing would please this man.

In addition to the bad service, the food was also very poor. I shouldn't have even ordered a cannoli because I could see it was filled ahead of time, which is always a bad sign. The pastry was, of course, soggy and not the crisp cannoli texture you want. The tiramisu my friend had was super watery and overly soaked in coffee.

Save your money and go to one of the many other places to grab a pastry in North Beach!
author: Lauren P.

description: Once we arrived to the bakery, we didn't understand the bad ranking - there was so so so much to choose from! We ordered some danish pastry and an almond croissant and ended up being very disappointed and I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. First, it was quite difficult to order because two ladies who work there were having some huge discussion. Then, it was almost impossible to sit down because there's not much space inside and one of the tables was occupied by employees' food in tupperware and covered with newspaper. Then, we got a dirty fork (it had some dried chocolate on it, we didn't order anything with chocolate) and on the top of that, the croissant was really stale and I could probably break their window with it, like solid rock. The danish pastry was good.
author: Kateřina H.

description: They have really good tiramusu and latte. But definitelly not $ it should be $$ or $$$
author: Osman K.

description:
Not bad but stuff gets stale later on in the day. They don't turn out fresh product in the evenings. The place looks a bit rundown but you can get some good stuff if you get there in time. We bought some pastries but they weren't as fresh as they could have been. They were sitting in the window all day but they were still full price. I'm sure they were good at some point. 

Service could have been better. Felt there was no connection with the cashier because she was on her cell phone while she rang us up. No bueno.
author: Michael D.

description:
Love this place; great assortment of pastries/sweets for a affordable price.  Cannoli is like &5, slice of cake, $6.  I also LOVE their amaretto nut gelato, so good and light in almond flavor.  

Everything is fresh, the girls are informative and great at describing the desserts.  

Definitely a must for anyone passing by!
author: A. Christina S.

description:
I came here on a whim since we were in the area and wanted to grab a cup of coffee and pastry before getting on with our day. 

We stepped in because of the enticing view of pastries that they had in front of the window. They had very many pastries to choose from so it was really hard to decide on one. My friend decided to get a tomato / pizza looking pastry and we also ordered 2 cappucinos. 

Total was around $12 which is a bit pricey but to be expected for this area. The store owner warmed up the pastry for us so it was nice and warm.  The cappucinos tasted great and had a nice coating of cocoa powder on top. 
 
I'd probably come here again but just to get a pastry to go since the drinks are a bit overpriced.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
Very rude customer service by the guy working the front of the counter. I asked several questions about the pastries window side and he gave some crappy answers with some unwanted attitude. 

I got the almond croissant and the butterfly pastry. The almond croissant was very flaky and delicious even though it was a little sweeter than I anticipated. The butterfly tasted a little stale but it had a sweet taste to it.

Mara's Italian Pastry is an adequate place for some espresso and  a quick bite if you live really close in North Beach. Unfortunately it's not worth travelling for, even if their cannolis were voted some of the best in the SF area.
author: Philip M.

description:
The employees here only speak Spanish. Two very bitchy women work at the cafe and are rude, noisy and don't give two ounces about there job.

The most appalling thing is I ordered a latte here and they didn't put in a fresh espresso into the canister; they reused it and my latte tasted burnt and coppery. I explained they need to use a fresh espresso for each latte. Someone DID NOT train these women to make proper coffee.  And they couldn't understand my English so when I started to speak Spanish they finally did what I asked.  But they started to say things like "chinga de madre" WOW
All the other customers were so appalled and started to say they need to be nice. They just rolled their eyes continued to speak Spanish and laughed.  Very rude.

I highly NOT recommend this place also their pizzas sit out all day and it doesn't remain fresh.

This is an appalling place that calls themselves Italian. Dios mio! As someone who lived in Tuscany a couple years there is an insult to Italian dolci e caffe!
author: Ana L.

description: Went in on a Friday night around 9 pm. got 2 mini canollis made sure these were orig flavor with choc. chips she ensured yes, they were NOT when we got back to hotel, they were cold, hard just plain filled ones.
author: Elena B.

description:
Glad they stay open late. This is a perfect way to end your night after dinner. Just coffee, pastries, and some night conversations. 

They have a good variety of biscotti, cookies, and sweets from cannoli, cheesecake, cream puffs, tarts, etc.
author: Chrys M.

description: This cafe is fairly small, but what it lacks in space, it makes up for with high quality coffee and treats at decent prices. I haven't tried many of their traditional Italian pastries but the Cannolis here are excellent, they are filled completely and are available in a variety of flavors for less than you'd pay at some of these other establishments. This cafe also offers a wide range of espresso drinks in single, double, or triple shots, so the sky is the limit here when it comes to how jittery you can get. Oh, I almost forgot to mention the pizza, they make some of the best tasting foccacia pizza in all of North Beach, good enough to make a trip to this neighborhood for a taste :)
author: Joseph A.

description: I LOVE the pastries. They taste just like European pastries of my youth. It's pricey but so worth it in my opinion. If you want a real pastry, this is THE place. Hands down.
author: Katie D.

description:
-2 for the customer service. Was here a few Saturdays ago and the lady behind the counter was totally rushing us..and was curt.  She was not Italian, I'm not too sure of her name or whatever, but she was rude.  There's also an Italian guy (Verbicarese) who works there.. he's kinda rude, too.  Dude, I'm a Cirimele... obviously from Verbicaro- you could at least try and be nice!!! Sheesh.

The pastries were pretty good. The napolitana was good and creamy and fresh. My sis got some items from the front window that were cinnamon. They were good but you could tell they were1-2 days old.. :-/  They were yummy with coffee...

We do love this place tho because they have a picture of Verbicaro on the wall. My whole family is from there... They just need to up their customer service skills.
author: Mary C.

description:
Rude & unfriendly but willing to take your money for stale pastries. 

I've visited this pastry shop before and was very happy that I happened by. I'd never heard of the place before, so it was an any, mini, miney, moe type thing, the first time I tried this spot. The cinnamon pastry boat was so delicious & fresh, it took my tastes buds to a whole other level. So needless to say when I came back into town, this place was On My List. 

Brothers & Sisters please, for the love of that is tasty & mouthwatering, Do Not Come Here!  The service is HORRIBLE, the pastries were stale & after I purchased my pastries, I noticed there were fruit flies!! 1 cinnamon boat & 1 almond croissant costs $8.50 which is not bad & I wouldn't have minded if the service wasn't so tertible.

I will never ever ever ever be back. It's not worth my time or money. Period.
author: Shania W.

description: Was in the neighborhood randomly Terrible service. Price is high but the area is that way. Desert was only okay. Will not be coming back
author: David D.

description:
The canoli are great here but even better the macarons!!! you gotta try the lemon, raspberry and the chocolate macarons. Seriously delicious. it really blew me away beacuse you don't expect great macarons from a little Italian shop! 

Not the friendliest service, just pay and leave basically. There's few seats inside and out, so you can sit down and eat your treats.
author: Tamara S.

description:
Went there tonight. Couple people in line. Not super service BUT PASTRY IS SO GOOD!!!!!

Not very big pastry fan but this feels so European. 
Really miss good taste of food. 
Size is huge!
Taste is good!

Took away a whole box of different pastry. 
Planned to have those for breakfast tomorrow morning... Nope nope nope already had one. 
It is really huge. 

Space inside is pretty small so I could suggest take away. 
It was very very busy this evening. 
I assume that customer service is not very good because they have to work Saturday night :P
author: Marianna P.

description: Unfortunately, the service is lacking so much that I will personally never give them my business again. They have a sign at the window that states they have the best Cannoli in San Francisco with a 4 star rating but their service doesn't even deserve a 1. I went in on Mother's Day at around 6:30 (in case the owners care to know which of their staff members could use intense training) & the woman behind the counter was incredibly rude & embarrassingly unknowledgeable about the items they were selling. Everything was filled with "whipped cream" or she'd just call it bread. I should've known that she was rude since the customers in front of us were receiving terrible service, she was so frustrated with them that she even gave them the wrong pastries & they were just as frustrated so they took what they could. Let's move on to myself & my boyfriend, she gave us the same service, we would ask what the pastries were, etc etc etc, & she gave nothing but terrible descriptions (if we can call them that). I am clearly pregnant (there's no way she didn't notice) & she failed to disclose that a pastry I purchased was drenched in rum, it wasn't until I was halfway up the block & had taken a piece of it that I realized it had rum. That is an extremely irresponsible way to run a business & like i said, just for the service alone I will never be going back. The place itself is small, it's very homey so I can't say it's impeccable, the pastries all look delicious & what I was able to try was extremely tasty but when you receive such poor service, it's difficult to see yourself going back. Hopefully the owners or management can train their staff properly because I see that it's a very common complaint.
author: Stephany L.

description:
Definitely not the place for a coffee, they charge you for a double espresso without being a double one.
They have good pastries but totally overpriced.
The reason I give one star is because the service was beyond non polite and it was very clear trying to take advantage of the tourist.
By the way I feel sorry because the lovely little Italy is being disappearing because this kind of attitudes.
author: Isaac L.

description:
I visited San Francisco while walking Chinatown and  Little Italy I came across this place that have pastries in the window in a very inviting fashion. After the Delight to my eyes, the whole experience was very sour thereafter rather than the expected sweet experience.

The pastries were rather stale and didn't taste all that good. The cafe mocha had an unusual aftertaste which I'm not sure what it's all about. Maybe bad water they use here. The two Spanish speaking  ladies made a mistake in counting our pastries and charging us. They said they could not come up with a receipt for us. They said they would not refund us which is okay I just wanted to credit to buy additional pastries. Overall they have a thing or two to learn about customer service because they were very confrontational and rude.  

If you want enjoy something sweet and tasty, try somewhere else. If you want to experience good customer service without anyone attempting to ruin your experience definitely go somewhere else.

We will come back to Little Italy in San Francisco over we will not be seeing this place ever again.  Enter at your own risk. Cheers
author: David G.

description: A few days ago we were enjoying the North Beach Area and happen to walk by this inviting bakery window. My family was happy to go in to pick out a treat.  The man who helped us was pretty rude, almost like he's annoyed we were there. He didn't greet us or even thank us. Spending about $40 on 4-5 pastries is pretty steep. Also, even though we chose small and larger items, looked like he arbitrarily chose to just charge us $6.50 per pastry. Some of the pastries were good but not excellent, especially at that price. Made me think he thought we were tourist that he should take advantage of. With his attitude he made me think he didn't need my money. There are other businesses in the area who might be happy we spend money at their establishment. He can keep his pastries and that sour attitude.
author: MARJORIE S.

description: Frankly speaking - this pastry visit usually one of our must-do activity for SF weekend trip. Just try their white cream roll with coffee and you will love it.
author: Ruslan A.

description: The Pastries were pretty good. Not Ferrara's but okay. The Service and Prices though! Two Ladies behind the counter were not friendly and seemed annoyed, like it was a burden to sell me an espresso, some Pignoli and one stale ass Sfogliatelle. Won't be getting my Money again.
author: Joey S.

description: Stumbled upon this place in Little Italy- was lured in by the showcases of desserts in the window, but incredibly disappointed by the quality and service. We ordered the tiramisu, chocolate cake, and mistakenly, the limoncello cake (which we thought was cheesecake). Unfortunately, there was a strong language barrier, and the employees were not able to answer simple questions about the desserts, which is the reason why we ordered limoncello cake by accident. We sat down to indulge in our desserts, but immediately noticed that there was a bug in the inside of our tiramisu (gross!) When asking for a new one, they were not very remorseful and we were just overall disappointed. Both cakes seemed to be a bit dry and bland. The replacement tiramisu was decent, but not anything amazing. Wouldn't recommend stopping here! :(
author: Grace M.

description: YUM YUM YUM went here on a friend's recommendation and so glad we did! $4.50 for a pastry that was nearly the size of my face. This is also a proper italian bakery, quality baked goods, a huge selection and absolutely delicious. There's also seats inside and outside. Would 100% go again.
author: Elina G.

description: Sat out front in a little table cafe style.  Great apple turnover and raspberry pastry (looked like a wreath).  Fantastic...
author: Bernard C.

description: CANNOLI'S are delicious here! My friend and I each had one. Creamy filling, crunchy and chocolatey outside. What's not to like? Now I'm wishing I tried other things, which I guess is a reason to go back.
author: Kylie L.

description: Are you kidding me!!! For a slice of $6.50 Oreo Cheesecake, I deserve a little bag. I asked the server to have the cheesecake to go. He kept asking me to eat it at the shop. Excuse you, I don't want to eat it now. He refused to pick it to go. I told him I DO NOT not want to eat it now, please give me a bag. Finally I got a bag to go. How rude!!!  The cheesecake is not worth the money. Taste stale. Disappointed.
author: AMC C.

description:
The cakes are very good with creamy layers of deliciousness.
The cannoli was pretty good but I felt the biscotti was a little too hard, definitely requires a coffee dunk.
author: MaKenzie A.

description: We got here 30 minutes before they closed and ordered dessert.  The place looked so cute from the outside and the dessert looked so delicious.  But when we went in to order dessert, the woman who worked there was really rude to my boyfriend and me.  She also lied to us and said the cafe would be closing in 10 minutes and when we sat down to eat our dessert she started stacking all the tables and chairs around us.  It made us so uncomfortable that we got up and left.  Even though the cafe was not closed, when other people came in she turned them away.   Five minutes later when we were walking by, the woman who worked there was sitting in the cafe by herself and eating dessert.  I would not recommend this place and I would not go back.  They obviously don't want anyone's business.
author: Ghazal S.

description: Our all time favorite pastry shop.  Have been buying the Raspberry ring, almond pastry and apricot sticks for decades.  Prices have gone up substantially over the years at 4.75 each now...so I gave it 4 stars.
author: Marcia Y.

description: Stale cakes ($6.50 each), mediocre biscotti ($2) and a tiny tasteless cookie ($.75) combined with lousy service earns this North Beach tourist trap bakery 2 stars.
author: melita s.

description:
Must have got the same rude guy as Philip M.  He doesn't like customers and is very curt when you ask questions.   I'm here right now & don't think I'll enjoy the cookies we just bought.  Think I'll eat them later. 

 My boyfriend's amaretto Gelato didn't taste very good  because the almonds in it were stale - like the service.
author: Ruthie V.

description:
Small hole in the wall place filled with wonderful pastries and desserts. Along the window side you can see all the different kinds of items that they have. The cookies are amazing!! You must try the pine nut cookie for sure! 
They also offer gelato ice cream, but dont have any flavors.

This Italian place deserves not only stars but also a big thank you for keeping the originality!
author: Brittany C.

description:
I love this little slice of Italy. I love their baked goods and espressos.

I didn't love nor did I feel any love today whilst strolling through little Italy on a beautiful Spring day when I decided a pastry, double espresso and glass of water would go down rather well.

I walk in, clearly stated my desire to enjoy at the vacant table in front of their shop a double espresso, pastry and glass of water. Whilst settling the bill for my order a women and child sat down in what had become for me a symbol of rest and relaxation to eat their ice cream purchased elsewhere.

Yes, I'm a spoiled little brat as I tucked my disappointment not managed at all well under my arm and marched out the door, leaving my purchases on the inside table where the temperature approximated the second concentric circle of Hades (will Yelp! catch this word?).

Next time I return and I will return so good are the pastries, I'll be sure to bring a hammer and nail with which I'll affix to table a sign proclaiming, "paying customer to be seated momentarily" and offer to help whomever was behind the counter to extract their thumb from their bottom lest they contribute to dashing paying customers' dreams of enjoying a double espresso, pastry and glass of water on a beautiful Spring day.
author: Jay D.

description: I must say, when I walked past the window of pastries I literally passed, stopped and turned around. Everything looked so delicious, specifically the chocolate dipped apple fritter. I went in, and ordered without even thinking cost... oh my, next time I am asking... $4.95 for one apple fritter! All I could think was that this better be the best fritter ever. Unfortunately, it wasn't. It tasted like it was a day old, i.e. dry, dry, dry. There wasn't a hint of cinnamon. It was probably one of the worst fritters I have had. I also have to say, the man in the store was definitely more interested in his newspaper than helping me. It was a little strange because it took time to get his attention.
author: Tonya G.

description: I bought the seven layer cookies. One dollar each for a tiny piece and horribly stale. Inedible. They should be embarrassed to sell products like this. Bad show.
author: Geena L.

description: Decent coffee with fine cannoli. We sat outside for coffee and a break from sight seeing. Well, we turned into sight seeing for other tourists as the tourist buses were passing by and we noticed people were taking photos of us which I can only assume was because of our spectacular looks. There is no restroom in this place so don't drink too much water with your coffee. nearest restroom is in nearby park and you have to crawl there if you were under the same pressure as I was! World is in a different color when you are under pressure!
author: Kamran N.

description: Today I got mocha, one slice of cheesecake, one  cup of cream brûlée and one tiny cup of chocolate mousse, they changed $23.05 on my credit card, I left without looking at my receipt. I checked on my receipt after a fee mins, I went back there again to ask for the original price for each item, the lady was being impatient and rough to me, she gave me very bad attitude, made me feel like I was bothering her. I will never go back there again not only they are rough but also they are very pricey. I wish I could give zero star to them but Yelp did not allow me.
author: Dnc L.

description: A small little bakery on a busy street. The cannoli's here are amazing, as well as their macaroons, but the service, however, is terrible! The few times I've come in for some pastries, the workers always seem very agitated and unfriendly. Maybe it's due to the number of customers in that tiny bakery? Either way, this place is more of a "buy what you want and leave". There are some tables and chairs, but with the small place, people are bumping into each other more than they are enjoying their awesome cannoli.
author: Victoria K.

description: Tiny little shop with lots of wonderful looking pastries in the front window. I couldn't help myself. They looked so good. I have a sweet tooth for bear claws. I saw that and had to go in. Well I tried the cannoli as well. Both of them were very good. That's the first time ever eating a cannoli so I really don't have anything to judge it to. Lol polite staff. The coffee was ok not great. The pastries are top notch though.
author: Keith H.

description: Great little Italian pastry and dessert shop in Little Italy of San Francisco. There's some seating inside as well as a table or two outside. Stroll right up to the counter and order a bit of everything! Cookies are by weight so you can mix and match to your hearts content.
author: Isabella L.

description:
Delicious pastries. Bad coffee. (I had an "iced cappuccino" which was just out of a machine in a paper cup with ice cubes in it). Not cheap.
Service not exactly friendly (no smiles or thank you from the man who served us).
author: Gemma Z.

description: Cheese cannoli is so good!!! Have to try it while at little Italy in SF. Cheese filling is creamy and icy and the crispy cracker wrap is just the right balance for the sweetness. The window pastry display will definitely catch your attention. At least it lured me in and their cheese cannoli doesn't disappoint.
author: Mingyue Y.

description: Needed a snack after eating a delicious pizza and came across Mara's Italian pastry. My aunt and I shared a small cannoli along with a madeleine cookie. We also got a cappuccino and a caramel macchiato. All purchases were superb! Not only did everything taste great but pricing was also great. It was super cheap and they could easily charge more!! They offer a variety of pastries.. I only wish that we could have tried them all.
author: Emily O.

description: I usually go to Cafe Greco of Stella's Pastry for a good cannoli. This place was so foul! The ladies that work here were eating a sandwich while they made coffee and used their hands to handle money and the cannoli. The cream inside the cannoli was off and the coffee beans used for the Nutella latte were used over and over again for each coffee. The Nutella latte was hands down the worst coffee ever and the lady just squirted a blob of Nutella in the Luke warm coffee at the end!i
author: Ruwanie B.

description: I'm giving this place one star because they have great pastries but than their showcase it's so dirty full of dust and bugs ! How can you eat food from a tray on the floor and two lazy girls who don't pay  attention and keep talking to each other ! Tipical retarded customer service with no skills unwelcoming !top of the shame is that they keep touching the pastries with hands no gloves and eating from the same tray they have the cakes on -disgusting !!!! I won't be back ever
author: Ivana P.

description:
I've been going to this bakery for over 40 years, till now.
The big glass windows display a beautiful array of handmade pastries.  
I was in for a big surprise when the cookies and biscotti's (huge selection of flavors) were sold by the pound, my little 2 inch round powder sugar cookie was $2 and the biscotti was $3.79.  Geez, 2 regular coffee and 2 cookies came to $8.51.  Good, but too expensive and not worth the trip back.
author: Lawrence W.

description: Recently took a box of Italian pastries for some family. The quality of the pastries is excellent here. I imagine it is one of the many Italian shops that have been run by family for generations.
author: Adarsh P.

description:
Crappy ass attitudes. 

Custard was good - vibe was not. Advice: I'd spend the extra second Yelping somewhere with more passion involved.
author: Tiffany B.

description: it was the only place in california that we knew of that sold pistachio and strawberry leaf cookies we had back east, but they no longer had them. regardless we couldn't leave empty handed with all the other sweets they had.
author: NYSD G.

description: I try to stop here for a coffee and pastry anytime I'm in town! Their pastries are fantastic, and I really like their cappuccinos. It's a simple little shop - not much in the way of decorations/ambience, but for me that's part of its charm. Service is always very quick and friendly/professional.
author: Nicki S.

description: There are many varieties of baked good on display. They do look appealing through the window, but the taste of their cannolis were disappointing. They're really expensive about $11 for two cannolis and they were the worse I've ever had. I don't think I'll come back to this place again.
author: Mandy D.

description:
I got their coffee and cannolis the past couple of times I dropped by this place!

Their cup of coffee is simple - don't expect fancy here!

They have a lot of pastries to choose from, but I grab the cannolis every time because it is pretty good!

With the competition around this place that is selling the same types of pastries, gelato and coffee, this place is average to me.

The ambiance and exterior isn't quite welcoming.  The pastries on window display looks delectable, but they don't look jaw dropping.  However, the pastries do draw a passerby, such as myself, being suckered in to check the place out.

If you go in and buy something, bring cash! It is a cash only place!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Fantastic Italian Pastries in the North Beach area!  This is what you need to do: Go to dinner at any number of amazing Italian Restaurants near by.  Then after stuffing yourself, get up and walk it off by walking to Mara's for dessert.  They have incredible canolis and an amazing assortment of other Italian pastries.  Several different kinds of biscotti, so they must be open in the morning for coffee dunking.  After reading their reviews on Yelp, they appear to be a staple of the neighborhood and have quite a history.  See the pictures- amazing bakery!
author: JJ P.

description: We make sure to come here every time we end up in NB.  The cookies are delicious and I love their cannolis!
author: Stephanie M.

description: If you're tourist I don't recommend if you going to this place. 1) they rip you off!! $6 for single canoli. No price tag. It's whatever the worker tells you 2) they say cash only but they have a credit card machine with major credit card signs.... 3) taste is okay.... nothing special...
author: Ethan H.

description: cannoli!! some good stufff  1st time having it some really good pastry for 5 dollar little pricy but sure is worth it tasty is out of this world flavorful fluffy and a good snack check them out cannoli good eats yelp on yelpers
author: sushiatown s.

description: We tried the vanilla chip and chocolate gelato. Delicious! They have tons of pastries and coffee options here as well. Definitely feels like a little part of Italy.
author: Wendy L.

description: Don't recommend to tourists at all. We were overcharged by mistake and they wouldn't fess up to their mistake. We were two people so we ordered two coffees and one pastry. They made one extra coffee by mistake and would not deduct the price from the bill even though it was their mistake. They pretended that the total was correct. But they had all the calculated two drinks into the bill. It made no sense. The numbers didn't add up and the Spanish speaking Lady would keep rolling her eyes and pretending nothing was happening. She gave me the receipt but the numbers were not broken down. The cold makes sense and so when I asked the price for each item and added it in front of her she would not except that an error was made. Finally they tried to give us an extra pastry because they knew they had made the error. They said sorry we can't give you your money back. Get something else as credit. This was fine to us we just wanted acknowledgement. I'm not going to go here again. They knew what they were doing it we're not truthful so I left a really bad taste in my mouth.
author: Samaneh P.

description: I remember Mara's as the coffee shop with all the massive (and delicious looking) pastries in the window. I finally went for coffee and dessert one night and ate so much that I could barely walk home. I got a White Mocha and a big slice of Chocolate Cheesecake, while my boyfriend got a Caramel Macchiato and a massive Chocolate Covered Apple Fritter. Both drinks were good, but my White Mocha was absolutely perfect. Apple Fritters are never my top pick, but this one was super moist (sorry for the word choice) and tasted great with the chocolate glaze. But at the same time, nothing will ever beat Chocolate Cheesecake.
author: Carolina S.

description: A very nice Cannoli and Americano!  You have to stop by whenever near Little Italy in San Francisco.
author: Anthony B.

description: Over priced.  Unfriendly, unhelpful staff.  Quality not worth the price. Should have gone to Stella Bakery. A half pound of cookies and 4 small cannolis $23. Thought I was ripped off until I read other reviews.
author: Michele G.

description:
The eight of us dropped in after dinner last night as Sotto Mare restaurant where we ate dinner doesn't serve coffee or dessert. As I entered Mara's,  I noticed TripAdvisor's certificate of excellence 2014 sticker on the front window.  So this morning I took time to read the reviews posted on TripAdvisor's website.  The most recent cited stale pastries. 

I've been here off and on for years.  Maybe I've purchased stale pastries, maybe I haven't.  I can't recall.  I typically get the biscotti so I can dip it.  They've got like half a dozen different types.  Hubby and I both got the almond chocolate dipped biscotti. He ordered an Americano coffee, and I got the caffe mocha.  

I'm too full so I saved the biscotti for home. I had it for breakfast today.  It wasn't stale and it wasn't too hard.  It was good.  When we left last night past 9pm, there were still plenty of pastries in the front window and inside.  Maybe the key is a great espresso or an espresso drink.  Then your pastry will be better tasting.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Horrible attitude by this man that was working made me sick of the place as soon as I walked in but i didn't want to walk around anymore looking for a Cannoli, i felt like i was in a English conservative, republican, Yuppy pastry shop instead of a laid back Frisco Italian pastry shop f**k North Beach, Rude guy and you know who you are!! 
I ordered my Cannoli and when I got it, it was nothing but just a Cannoli simple good filling chocolate dipped but no powdered sugar on it I mean come on all the money you get in a upper class part of San Fran and u cant afford a little powered sugar for the customer and when I asked No sorry no powdered sugar its like are you serious not even for like 50 cents extra and it was good after I inhaled it, I mean come on a little bit bigger for $5 bucks man, this is America but worst of all I watched the  Lookism and preferential treatment given to me because of my physical attractiveness and because I did not match the cultural preferences of this man I watch him treat a man who ordered after me and to other ladies better based on there casual clothing like really I have to be dressed like im going to the ball for you to treat me like an equal but based on the area in San Fran im sure every single person who works there will treat the little less fortunate people in the world like me the same based on Lookism before I left I kindly asked the man What was the name of the place just to make sure and he instantly looked at my colorful t shirt and said Mara's with a disgusted face and it was embarrassing in front of the other stuck ups who were there in the place and it really made me feel like I was a fool for spending my money there, overall experience, expensive for the quantity and quality and horrible service based on my class and laid back clothing I was wearing, " F"  you to the man that works there and put some dam powdered sugar on your Cannoli's cheap bastards never coming to place again in my life will tell everyone i know not to go there.
author: Mickey G.

description: We went here on a whim to get some dessert and cappuccino. They make Lavazza coffee so that was the decision maker! The service was nice and so was the store front. I order a napoletana and cappuccino and they were superb! I really enjoyed it! It was the perfect way to end the night. There are about five tables in the place with two outside. But none were taken when we went, but we went later at night before close! Definitely a good place to check out! There are TONS of pastries!
author: Alex C.

description: Worst cappuccino ever--- and terrible service. Used to be a great place for parties, was very disappointed that it has succumbed to tourists.
author: Beth C.

description:
My that's a big biscotti you have there.  It has heft.  It's a girthy biscotti if ever there was one. 

I sat out front one evening watching the world go by while I enjoyed a decaf latte and a chocolate dipped almond biscotti.

Service was ok, the coffee was decent and the biscotti was good...and large.
author: Jim W.

description:
The last dish of our North Beach food tour was a dessert from Mara's Italian Pastry.  It was a layered cream cake. I cannot recall the name of it unfortunately.  It wasn't a tiramisu, but had a almond cookie on the sides of it. 

This cake was delicious.  The cream was frozen, that it tasted like ice cream. Making it taste like an ice cream cake.  Really delicious and a sweet closing of our tour.
author: Marck N.

description: Gave me frozen Frutti di Bosco! He kindly replaced it with an eclair but nothing seeems to be fresh here..
author: K K.

description:
I was sooooo excited to try this place yesterday! Went in last night wanted to try some of the lovely Italian treats.  Much to my DISAPPOINTMENT I went ready to spend some $$$$! 5 men sitting around not sure if they worked there. They all looked NO ONE BOTHERED TO HELP ME!
I stood there waiting for waiting for someone to come assist me.  Very poor customer service felt very uncomfortable in my "skin"!  sad but true. 
If they did not want my $$$ I wasn't going to give it to them! Went over to "STELLAS PASTRIES" great customer service!
author: Lisa L.

description:
A cute, small, hole-in-the-wall cafe with delicious home baked Italian pastries and fresh made gelato. The cream-filled eclairs are delicious! Not too sweet and their cannolis are equally as great. I always come to this bakery when I'm in the bay. 

It's a favorite and I'll continue coming back :)
author: Shareen D.

description:
I've been a customer here for the better part of 15 years. No trip to the city is complete without a trip to Mara's to get one of their Great Cannoli's...

They make the best cannoli's, and their cappuccino is pretty damn good too! I've always loved that they're open til midnight on Friday, and Saturday. As I'm always headed there after 10pm!!!

Lately, my routine at Mara's includes sitting out front with the Girlfriend, and our two doggies. People watching, and enjoying a scrumptious late night Italian treat! 

My dogs are always very alert just waiting for me to drop a crumb of cannoli, but that ain't happening! :)
author: Anthony C.

description: Too overpriced. Each pastry was $6.50-$7, there weren't any prices posted. It was too expensive for the quality. The staff weren't friendly either. Bummer bc this place was super cute.
author: Lissette L.

description: Almost 4 years later, it's still my faovrite spot in Little Italy! I have made the 45-minute drive on more than one occasion just to sit on the patio of Mara's and enjoy a cappucino and Napoleon or cannoli and listen to the Italian locals and owners behind the counter. It's the fastest way to escape to 'Italy' for a few minutes.
author: Leila M.

description:
Tiramisu is my second favorite dessert, cheesecake is my favorite.

After having tried it at many different places, this has got to take the prize for 1st place.

Bitter sweet chocolate with layers of creamy mascarpone which is probably mixed with some sort of whipped cream because it was fluffy and sweet. I was in heaven. I also tried a few other cookies whose name I do not remember because the tiramisu was out of this world good.

The coffee is awesome! hubby got a decaf and I got an espresso macchiato that was paired perfectly with my tiramisu.

I want to go to San Francisco and have this many many many more times.
author: Evelyn V.

description: This is the most unfriendly and dirty place ever. Attitude from the server who disappears in the midst of Friday night madness. The owner should be appalled. How much business has been lost because of the rude uncaring employees. Disgusting!!
author: Karen D.

description: We randomly walked into this bakery & had the cannoli and custard filled pastry thingy. Both were delicious! Would love to return and try more goodies & the gelato!!
author: Miho N.

description: The best canoli in town for 42 years running, this quaint bakery will fulfill all of your sweet tooth needs. You will feel like you're really in Italy when you stop in and try their tasty treats.
author: Erica R.

description: We walked in for an afternoon pick-me-up.  As we walked in, we saw two servers behind the counter eating, uninterested in helping us. They were bothered when my young nephew asked them to describe spumoni. One of the women said, "...a mix of flavours..." My nephew opted for strawberry gelato and the rest of us got cannoli, sfogliatelle, and coffee. Whilst the pastries were ok, not excellent, but better than average, the service was substandard. Both women continued their conversation the entire time, ate their lunch, and neglected the dirty tables. Even if the pastries were better than most, the service, or lack of, scares me away. We will not be back.
author: Robert M.

description: How is a cannoli 5$?! But I guess it's about the same at any joint in this neighborhood. Anyway, it was just okay. I'd recommend picking on up someplace else where there's more (outdoor!) seating!
author: Shendi X.

description: Coming here this morning was fantastic because the cannoli that I ordered was good, but as we were waiting to order, the guy was really nice! Great service!  I would love to come back to eat some of their other kinds of pastries.
author: Brittany L.

description: A lil bit of everything here in san Fransico we have been pretty much everywhere they have pistachio gelato never had it but I love pistachio ice cream and there cheese cake are really bomb is a really good place to come and have desserts any time I wish I live here lol sadly is my last day here in the bay area but rest assured I will becoming here next time I come back to San Fransico
author: Alex R.

description: Review is for customer service: Well, I hate to do this but, you don't force people out 20 minutes to closing because you want to go home early on a Saturday night. After spending $45 for dessert (it was really good, cafe latte and chocolate treats)  the lady on duty forced us out in the middle of eating. Sad.
author: William B.

description:
Huge selection of baked goods,
visible from the window as you walk past. Don't be fooled. Their treats are no treat. They look way better than they taste. My daughter got a pretty cookie that tasted like cardboard. My other daughter got a cannoli that was soggy on the bottom. Ick. Walk on by and find someplace else for dessert instead.
author: Erin S.

description: $3 for a small gelato that is deliciously creamy - definitely a fan! They have far fewer flavor options than next door but they are cheaper and have indoor seating.
author: Amy Y.

description:
HEADS UP!! CASH ONLY HERE FOLKS!

While searching for a good bakery near a restaurant, I found this little gem and was very pleased! The variety of all the goodies was just perfect, so of course I had to have a little bit of everything. 

French macarons, tiramisu, cannolis, everything was so good! And I did manage to share with my bf and his parents while here. I cannot believe the quality of all the products. Nothing was stale or off it was all very good! I will be back.
author: Felecia F.

description: Pretty good, cannoli was nice. Refreshing, light. The chocolate puff pastry 3 pc was ok. Lots of biscotti variety. Liked the desserts better at Stella. $$
author: Mukti P.

description: This is hands down the eat place to go for dessert and coffee.  Eclairs, cannolis, chocolate cake, gelato, Nutella latte... Everything is home baked and yummy.
