You can go to caffe delucci or l'osteria for a meal and then come here for dessert and coffee. In fact, if you're in a rush you can just grab the pizza squares to go withy the desert.  Not a lot of sitting room and no bathrooms though.  So just take it to go!
author: Susannah K.

description:
On our way to Coit Tower we saw the pastry next to some other gelato places. From the window all the pastries looked amazing.
Feels like a true italian bakery. We tried a Chocolate twist and cinnamon roll and a tiramisu and OMG!!!!
They also have a small assortment of gelato.
The place is small with a few little tables and the guy working there is not very nice, not rude either, but kinda cold when you ask them about the food.
Loved that in their business card they have the famous and funny line from the Godfather "Leave the gun, take the cannoli"
author: Gaby B.

description: The great apricot Danish I have ever had.  Also delicious chocolate croissant.  I go there ever time I am in San Fran.
author: Manolo G.

description:
Italian pastries with my cafe for breakfast?....hell, yeah!  

Although my hotel offered the standard pre-made egg cheese omelets, microwaved pork patties and cinnamon rolls, etc, I just had to pass on the buffet and headed to Mara's Italian Pastry.  A mom & pop shop offering a variety of Italian pastries baked and prepared using the recipes from the homeland.

Canolis, biscotti, turnovers, cookies, tiramisu and other tasty treats were offered by the Italian Bakery.  I brought three boxes of goodies to my morning meeting which everyone enjoyed!  I'll be back the next time I visit San Francisco.

3 Stars!
author: Maite H.

description:
They use waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaay too much butter. That may be some people's thing.. but I'm not into having my mouth feel like I just coated it with a layer of wax. 

I tried a giant butterfly cookie and have decided that Chinese people make them better. It may be the whole quality, not quantity thing. This cookie is GIANT! Chinese like to make them small, yet delicious. 

Also, the apple turnover was alright. I just feel like their butter really brings down the flakiness of the pastry (I'm not a baker though, so I could be totally wrong about the butter.. but either way, their pastries are pretty heavy).

I liked their latte though!

Oh yeah, and service, uh.. the guy didn't seem to happy to be serving me. It kind of seemed like he was trying to get me out of there as fast as possible!
author: Angela L.

description:
ALWAYS A MUST WHENEVER IM IN SF! 
I love maras! I absolutely must come every time I come to this city! LOVE their cannolis along with a coffee or latte, I got for their Nutella latte! Delish! Great for all hours of the day, and multiple times of the day! Hehe!
 
Lattes and Cannolis:
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=cFfpFIQS1MWmQBoF2CJ4NQ&userid=ZctVNNz-eQUZQzsU9qhQBQ

Cannoli up close:
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=XNbo-kXlTd2Hm1i5h8_cvw&userid=ZctVNNz-eQUZQzsU9qhQBQ

Nutella Latte:
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=jwbcyz0AliV86GZEoDvodw&userid=ZctVNNz-eQUZQzsU9qhQBQ
author: Kayla R.

description: I live for desert - I even order it before dinner.  This is such a great place that in the 3days I have been in San Francisco I have been here 3x's!  Amazing deserts - pastries and just a cool vibe - old Italian guys sitting outside speaking Italian. You don't get that everyday - I loved it. I hope to be back some day soon.  The whole 'little Italy' area is great and lots of fun at night don't miss out!
author: A L.

description:
From the looks (including the array of yum in the window), this place seems like it should be Old World excellence. It did not deliver. First, in an empty bakery, I stood there at the counter for a minute, making eye contact with BOTH of the guys behind it, while they continued to talk to each other in either Italian or Spanish (I couldn't quite tell). I mean, yes, a little bit of surly/brusque is expected in "authentic" shops, but that was over the top.

More importantly, just did not deliver on flavor. I skipped the sfogliatelle because they'd gone limp. The biscotti did have crunch... but were quite lacking in flavor. I could barely taste the anise or the nuts. Having had and liked Stella's before, I think I'm going back up the street next time.
author: Alik W.

description: I fell in LOVE with this place. Reminded me of back home. It was old school. I hate cannoli don't touch them. Their cannoli had me coming back for more. Was only here 4 days and went twice. I wish I could take some home but I couldn't. I got other things to take home though. Listen it's not the cheapest but you want quality you want good you want something that tastes lovely you pay a little bit more. Your in San Fran everything costs more here. Splurge it's GOOD!
author: Diana S.

description: Pastries are delicious and decadent.   However, the little shop could definitely use a facelift.  The décor is faded and dated.   I would best describe it as dumpy.    A cheerful new North Beach look would more than likely entice tourists to enter & indulge.   Next time I will get my pastries to go & have coffee elsewhere.
author: janice o.

description: Poisonous sweets.  They are plastered in the window so beware. Lol.  Pricey but a treat indeed. Good latte too
author: Stuart K.

description: Holy cannoli, amazing baked treats. It's every bride to be's nightmare!! I think I gained 5 lbs eating one cannoli but totally worth it!! The place is small and cozy, and even had an older gentleman speaking Italian in the corner as he read the sports page in his leisure suit! Loved it! The experience was unforgettable and I can't wait to return to little Italy and visit this place in the gorgeous city of San Francisco!
author: Mechelle V.

description:
Overall Impression: 3 star cream puff and a 5 star cannoli. Average? 4 stars!

Cost: Pretty expensive for both. Total came out to 11 bucks! I know they are a for profit business, but yikes!

Taste: The filling inside of the cream puff has the consistency and flavor of whip cream from a bottle. The cannoli, on the other hand, was delightful. The outside was essentially a delicious sweet waffle. Yum!

Customer Service: Very helpful woman behind the counter who guided us through all the choices.

Ambience/Atmosphere: We came there as the shop was about to close so there wasn't much to judge.
author: Kevin T.

description:
I believe customer service is everything. So this is why I starred 3. Poor on customer service. Everyone has a bad day so I might have come on an off day. Pastries and gelato speaks for itself.  Very delicious and the presentation at the front window will make u walk thru the door. 
Pastries are flakey and with a gooey center. Streusel and florentin are great. Amareto and nocciola gelato was creamy and good.
author: Nikole D.

description: Got the chocolate canoli, which was delicious! A bit pricey though ... Also they need to label their pastries because it's hard to decide what pastry you want when you don't know what it is.
author: Denny H.

description: Worst coffee I have ever purchased. I ordered a white chocolate mocha to go and they gave it to me in a cup to drink at the restaurant. I had them change it to a to go cup and it was less then half full! Instead of making a new one they poured cold milk to fill up my cup! I even told the kid behind the counter that I didn't want it to taste just like water and milk. Well it did! I asked for a new one and gave it to me with an attitude! Giving it one star for bad service!
author: Rosario M.

description: Not experienced in Italian pastries, but I enjoy this place. Quite pricey, however. ...
author: Grace C.

description:
Rude customer service and cash only bakery..why..
Had almond croissant and my husband had chocolate cake, two single mocha
Everything was too sweet and almond croissant was not soft..too dense
Will not go back and not recommend to anyone..
author: Jane K.

description:
Their apple turnovers and raspberry rings are the best I've ever had! Granted the 5 stars are only for those, but you won't be disappointed. The apple turnover is SO FRESH and just the right amount of sweetness. It's chock full of fresh apples as well. The hubby and I buy 3-4 to go and it lasts us about a week - they are too big for one person, so we always split it and it still makes us full!

I would love to try their other desserts (red velvet cake, cannolis, cookies, tiramisu) but the portions are too big and I always gotta have my original faves, that I run out of room. :P
author: Leigh R.

description: I love their chocolate dipped madeleines and hubby really liked the cannoli! They were out of coffee, so they brewed a new pot. Perfect dessert for a perfect dinner two doors down.
author: Ixchel M.

description: First of, I really wanted to like this bakery. It was quaint and cute. Beautiful pastries displayed at the window. I haven't been to a nice Italian bakery in San Francisco. It reminded me of Italian bakeries in the East Coast such as New York, Baltimore or Philly. I got carried away and purchased $30 worth of pastries. Cannolis were each for the smaller ones. Flaky crust but I feel that they could have put more filling and not worth their price. I also got 3 small pieces of rainbow cookies, a raspberry Danish looking pastry recommended by the server, and two chocolate twists. I am not sure how much the other items cost as they are not listed. The employee working was helpful but not too personable but there was a line of people there. Nice looking spot but not worth the price.
author: Cheryl C.

description:
This place has a bunch of different italian pastry..from cookies, cakes, to biscotti..

I got the dark chocolate or just chocolate almond biscotti..it was eh..I had better..seriously I think the packaged ones at Peet's tastes better. It's big though, but it costs $3, which is pretty pricey. 

It's a small coffee shop and takes cash only, and they do have a ton of pastry if you're into it. I think I would go else where, but other that..you won't catch me here again.
author: Minerva L.

description: Star rating is just for the tiramisu, which was the only thing i had here.  The cream tasted a little like cake frosting, and the lady fingers were tough and stringy instead of soft and fluffy.  Lots of other good looking choices, though, so maybe i just got the wrong thing.
author: Simon L.

description:
I don't know if the owner is Italian but the pastries are so good!!!!
Cheap and fancy!!!
Good Good Good .
author: Allie D.

description: Mara's is one of my regular SF stops because I love the Italian music, freshly made coffee and the tiramisu. Just strolling by the window and cases is a treat for the senses! Ciao down with cash only!
author: Catherine S.

description: We've been in San Fran for a week & made our way back to Mara's for the 3rd time. The Italian wedding cookies are the best I have ever had. My husband has had every type of canoli they make & thier dark chocolate layer cake is devine. Two thumbs up, Mara! There is a reason you have people standing in line.
author: L2 A.

description: I was looking for some lil dessert after dinner in North Beach and ended at this pastry attracted by the cannolis visible through the window shop. It was the right call, had a great creamy cannoli and a wonderful Lavazza espresso.
author: Fede R.

description:
Eh. 

A tiny little Italian bakery with so-so pastries and mediocre service. I had the strawberry chocolate cake, which was decent but a little soggy. The cookies were sort of stale and the chocolate mousse wasn't nearly thick enough for my liking. With so many other options in the neighborhood, I honestly can't think of a single reason to recommend this place over the others.
author: Josephine L.

description: Service wasn't awesome but i totally loved their cannoli's. I tried several and even went as far to have "leave the gun, take the cannolis" tattooeed on the back of my leg! Five star pastry, three star service!
author: Cornelis T.

description:
Tiny cozy Italian style Pastries you can find here whatever you want.
Cannoli, tiramisu, croissant, biscuit and all Italian pastries.
You can also find good espresso and cappuccino.
Highly recommend this place.
author: Bryan S.

description:
Another favorite in North Beach (the other is Caffe Roma across the street) - open late and coffee is delicious.  

What it lacks in ambiance is more than made up for in variety and more variety of pasterie. The person working the store the night I visited not only helped us with our choices, she made a mean latte.

I always pop into Mara when I am in SF.
author: Martha X.

description: Great pastry shop. The custard eclair was to die for. The chocolate chip cannoli was really good too (my last cannoli was from Mike's in Boston, so I'm a little snobbish on this front). The only real problem with the pastry was that the Palmier, puff pastry cookie, was a lot crispier than chewy which is sub par for a layered Italian pastry in my book. Other than that, the tastes were great, and I would recommend this place. Perfect for an after lunch desert or a pre-dinner snack ( that's what we visited for).
author: Shaun M.

description: Cannoli taste like paper here, filling is very dry so I was scraping it off my tongue trowel. Exterior is slightly stale with age. And it costs $5. What the what.
author: Ted M.

description: I was surprised to read some of the recent negative reviews. I went here on a Monday and all the pastrys and cannolis were fresh and delicious! Even a few days later they were good. We were waited on by the old Italian guy (owner maybe?). He was delightful! Maybe it was because I am of Italian decent that we got great service? Anyway, this place was amazing. I felt like I was with my Italian grandfather in the old country getting my indulgence on!
author: Amy A.

description:
After a gorging down the block for lunch,  the Lavazza espresso sign in front got my attention, so we popped in for an espresso and a sweet snack.  This spot is compact with no wasted space, and a million different options to snack on.  To accompany my espresso, I ordered an amazing little cookie- a pignoli amaretti- a delicious, traditional Italian little chewy cookie treat covered in pine nuts.  I ate it too quickly to take a pic! My only mistake was not ordering a bunch of these to bring home with me. 

This is probably the best of breed in North Beach, or at least in the conversation.  You'll find tiramisu, cannoli, pastries, gelato, and savory stuff like focaccia as well.  But my pick is surely the little amaretti.  I'll be back for them for sure!  Cash only FYI.
author: Andy S.

description:
I'll start off by saying my cannoli were really good, better than I expected, which was a nice surprise. The filling was perfectly light and not-too-sweet. The pastry itself was light, crisp and flaky. The end dipped in chocolate was perfect. 

However, Mara's seems like it might be running a scam on tourists, and there are always tourists around this part of the city. The pastries are all in the window or inside a glass case. Neither look incredibly sanitary, nor does the bakery itself. It isn't caked in mud or anything, but looks like it's been a while since someone has taken a bucket of soap and water to anything. 

Also, none of the pastries are refrigerated, which is a little puzzling. I guess they just have that much turn around. However, I know some of these pastries/baked goods have been sitting there a while. Maybe not days, but not fresh out of the oven.

Next thing is that the woman working the counter is unfriendly. I don't expect a fanfare, but a smile or a "hello" or even a "thank you" would be nice. 

My biggest problem is that I paid about $25 for 5 PASTRIES. 3 eclairs and 2 cannoli. This seems a little steep to me, but there was a line out the door, so maybe I'm mistaken. 

If you do stop in, the cannoli are a sure bet.
author: Bianca U.

description:
1. 3 girls at the counter & none greeted us- only eventually speaking when 1 asked what we wanted.

2. You can hear someone clipping their nails, but couldn't see who...that is until he stepped out from a wall behind the drinks fridge. Disgusting. He didn't wash his hands, started ringing people up, touching cash, etc.

3. The same nail cutting gentleman proceeded to take a dessert order & grabbed the cannoli with his BARE hands. Never washing them from the time he clipped his nails & touched cash. 

4. The cannoli was delish, but after watching everything, it definitely wasn't worth the effort to find a great cannoli.
author: Pris G.

description: Better than other Italian bakeries I've been to, and flavor is pleasing.
author: Nick H.

description:
First of all, how can you not wander inside this pastry shop when delcious pastries smile at you through the window. My will power is strong, but not that strong! The add in the sweetest old Italian gentleman and I'm sold. Every time I'm in SF, I always make sure to pay a visit to my favorite part of town, North Beach. Being part Italian and growing up surrounded by happy Italians always stuffing my face with amazing Itlaian food, I always crave it and visiting North Beach feels like home. Walking into Mara's makes me feel like I'm visiting an old relative and the owner and staff truly treats their customers like that! 

Before leaving town, I decided to stock up on some sweet treats to bring home to my husband. I ordered just about one of everything (or it at least felt like that) and the gentleman and his associate were so nice with helping me decide! Just went I thought I couldn't order anymore, the Italian gentleman insisted that I sit down an enjoy a warm croissant filled with Nutella. Oh my sweet goodness! I didn't know something could taste so good. Next time you want to jazz up your croissant, just cut it in half, douse it with Nutella and heat it up. You'll thank me later. My experience was so enjoyable that I didn't want to leave! 

The food here is just as enjoyable as the experience! Order the warm croissant and enjoy it inside, or stock with with Italian foccacia, bear claws, apricot pastries and everything out. You can't go wrong with anything on the list. I want to go back. Right now.
author: Lindsey D.

description:
Leave the gun, take the cannoli. - The Godfather

I am an Italian-American woman who grew up with authentic Italian cuisine, and I spent a year living in Italy, so trust me when I say that the cannoli at Mara's are great.

Feels like a typical European cafe; no frills, huge case of fresh baked goods, a few tiny bistro tables, and lots of native Europeans hanging out (at least when we visited on a Saturday afternoon). It's not "cheap" but I didn't have sticker shock either.

It's very walkable from Chinatown, and there's no shortage of other little cafes to peruse along the way, but hold off until you arrive at Mara's.

Our cannoli was perfectly paired with a cappuccino, and the apple fritter dipped in dark chocolate was insanely decadent as well.
author: Lisa T.

description:
I loved this pastry shop! My boyfriend and I were walking by it and decided to go in, all the pastries that are showcased in the front window look oh so delicious! 

My boyfriend decided to get a raspberry Gelato, it was delicious not too sweet or too bitter. 

I got a cannoli which I fell in love with. They're so fluffy and  it is filled with the perfect amount of creme. 

I also got a chocolate macaroon, and again another amazing treat. 

The staff was very patient and friendly. 

It's a nice little shop where you can sit outside and enjoy the environment, it feels as if you're in Italy hearing localsspeack itialian. I would def. go back to this place when in town.
author: Perla L.

description:
There are a LOT of bakeries to chose from in this neighborhood. In fact, there is a bakery next door to Mara's.

I peeked my head in both of them, and decided on Mara's, because they had more posters touting their cannoli's. Wrong choice.

At the register, after I had ordered, I was told they only accepted cash! I hate being blindsided like that! Not to mention that the employees here were just not friendly.

And then: insult to injury- my bill was around $35 for the 4 pastries I ordered!

Believe me, those pastries were not worth the price.

We had: 2 orders of creme brûlée. The custard was fine. But the topping was just a coarse sugar. I far prefer creme brûlée with the torched/caramelized sugar.

The slice of chocolate mousse cake we had was old, and fell apart easily.

And the cannoli? Nothing to write home about.
author: Brooke S.

description:
The cannolis! Creamy goodness! I got the combo ones with one side dipped in chocolate and one that wasn't.

Ahhh the cannolis!!! It was sooo good. I got the combo which had a chocolate dipped crust on one end and a non chocolate dipped on the other. The filling was so creamy and fluffy. I'd stay away from the pizza here. They don't even heat it up for you when you order it.. you have to ask them to.. Not only that, it tasted like bread with tomato sauce and toppings on it.. There wasn't even any crust!

Definitely stick to the desserts here.
author: Virginia Y.

description: Freshly baked Italian pastries and freshly brewed coffee. Great service. Very authentic.
author: Mercedes G.

description: The customer service is beyond horrendous, the people seemed genuinely unhappy to even have customers. Then, I paid $4.50 for a horrible, stale disgusting croissant. I left feeling upset, unhappy, hungry and sad.
author: Alison V.

description:
Great location for desserts, especially after eating at one of big Italian restaurants in North Beach. Selected the cannelloni- crusty pastry with creamy whip cream. Very tasty. I also ordered the cheesecake which was very tasty. 

There are pastries in the window outside and also in the glass case. I would recommend the pastries in the glass case. Have to have your desserts fresh. I just wish the server behind the counter was more polite and say thank you after the purchase. 

Outside seating would be a nice plus considering that there are other locations on Columbus that offer outside seating.
author: Jim D.

description: Like a New York dessert bar I recall as a kid....this place is everything you recall in an urban environment and can't wait to visit again if you go back 20 years later or more! You get a cap or latte and a nice 2000 processed sugar calorie based dessert and go! I have had a tiramisu a couple of times as well as deep chocolate cake and some kind of nut cookie that was really great and hard and scrunchie.I had italian ice cream here before as well.It's real small,real delicious and real all city.It's right in the heart of the  italian neighborhood of San Francisco and just a great anticipation when your walking around town!~ Do it!
author: Brian D.

description:
LUX SF Pastry Pit Stop
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
HEAVENLY PASTRIES! (see Yummy Pics & ignore the whiners)

DO NOT bother with other places that purport to sell "real" Italian pastries to tourists.
This is the real deal, and they have a plethora of LUX Pastries that will tempt any tastebud.
They do the job, but are neither fawning, nor really friendly (kind of like NYC).  If you shop like me in SF, I try to grab one or two huge boxes filled with all kinds of goodies, which will run you around $50-200.  We are talking really seriously delicious & fresh gourmet treats that you cannot find elsewhere in the SF/ Bay area, as far as I know.  This is not the processed garbage that they sell you at your local Star Bucket, Supercrapmarket or Costpoop Bakery.  I am sure that alot of this stuff is serve at the local upscale hotels & restaurants in SF....but they will not tell you the source.  Apparently, they do all the baking nearby and transport loads of these fresh goodies every morning to either this store, or most likely to the Ritz & other upscale places. 

You want real creamy heavy custard chocolate covered luscious Eclairs....you got them!

You want all kind of fancy-assed Biscotti with all kinds of nuts & flavors....you got those too!

You want all kinds of flaky sweet various shapes & size exotic pasties...you got those in spades!

The are literately many dozens of different choices....so what do you get....well two boxes of dozens of whatever appeals to you....and when you are at home with you family, you have a pastry tasting party! Yum Yum Yum!

BTW- I grew up in Brookyn, NY with Italians and always had either fresh Italian Pastries or Jewish Pastries almost every week, sometime homemade, many a time fresh from the local Bakery.  In my area, you just had to go a few blocks for great Bagels, Pizza, or Pastries.  You did not bother with crappy Supermarkets....you went to the Butcher, The Baker, The Fish Market, The Meat Market, The Bagel Store, The Ice-cream Store, & so on.

The only other pastries that we now go wild over are some real very limited homemade stuff made by a talented young lady at the Arroyo Grande, CA Farmers Market.  It sure beats traveling hundreds of miles to get to SF.

But if you are in SF anyway, this is the go to place for amazing Italian Pastries, which is right on the fringe of the North end of Chinatown.  It is a quite a good walk from either Union Square or Fisherman's Wharf...but you can alway cab or bus it back to your home base hotel. Parking here, like almost all places in central SF, is a nightmare...I always leave my car at the hotel & join the hoards of tourists & Chinese that are roaming every which way.

& if you are wondering, it is so so so superior to Chinese poor excuses for creamy pastry!

Chinese excel at many things, but not at this type of pastry.  Chinese Mooncakes (filled with Lotus Seed Paste & preserved Duck Yolks) & some Dim Sum (Mochi Hot Black Sesame Balls) can be amazing & may bring you good fortune & fertility to boot!

In regard to the many other whiny people:
           Who whine about using cash (bring cash dummy, this is Chinatown), this or that is better in Boston or NY (yeh, sure I am going to fly 3,000 miles for a Cannoli), or this was not so fresh (tough luck), that was too buttery (what?), the service sucked & they did not kiss my ass (kiss your own), the coffee was bad (yes, it does suck, it is not a coffee shop), the Biscotti was not flavored enough (WTF?), the Cannoli was soggy (life is tough), it was too sweet or not sweet enough, they do not clean enough, and ad nauseum.....

well all I can say, I have zero sympathy for all you whiners, grow-up or get out, no one really cares about your isolated one shot tourist experience....

yes, there will always be hits & misses at any shop that has such an extensive selection

.... but if you buy a box of a dozen things, you are bound to find some treasure

& guess what if you really want the freshest, go when they first open in the morning....all you whiny Einsteins....
author: Paul M.

description:
Arrived here after eating dinner nearby and I have to say the staff had a bit of attitude when asking if they would have anymore of their pastries, I do understand it was probably closing time or a few hours before (ovens probably off) but a nicer way would have been better in my opinion, and I am very easy to please.

After asking if they had Hot Chocolate both young ladies just looked at me, one did not even acknowledge, I saw the type of drinks they offer, but who does not do a Hot Chocolate? Well eventually one said yes, and she talked to the girl that never said a word in Spanish that she would do one, really, I look very Latin, why would you act as if I would not understand, or should I have spoken to them in Spanish from the get go? 

Pastries were okay, nothing to brag about, I think I will avoid this place next time in town.
author: Sal M.

description: We visited on 7/18. The pastries looked decent and we planned to buy several items. Unfortunately, the crotchety man behind the counter ruined our plans. We had the gall of asking a single question--what types of macarons are available (they had 4-5 types)? This simple question elicited such an incredible rolling of the eyes that I am positive that he saw his brain in the process. He acted like such a petulant child that we immediately left. This guy needs stronger meds and/or a different job. We strongly recommend taking your business elsewhere.
author: Omar G.

description: One word: cockroach. Lucky we saw it before we ate anything, they returned our money.
author: Katie F.

description: This is the best place for Italian pastries! The cannolis are honestly the best I've ever had! The staff is a little rude though.
author: Laura B.

description:
We ordered a nutella filled croissant and it was EMPTY. The next "nutella filled croissant" was EMPTY too. However, before the girl behind the counter handed it to me she slit it open to check and then proceeded to fill it with nutella haha! Not good. Imagine if I had ordered two nutella croissants to go? The girl did fill it up pretty good though. The croissant was pretty good! I ordered a nutella madeleine and it was not very nutellaey (is that a word? - now it is!) I was disappointed:(

My BF had a rather bland pastry which was dipped in chocolate.

Many of the pastries here are rather big! 

The place is cool. It has a big Italy champion of the world cup poster. Soccer rules! There aren't too many seats inside. The tables are kind of tacky. They have pictures stuck onto the surface and covered by varnish. 

They also sell gelatto here. The Targetera had some but I do not know if she liked it much.

This place is located on Columbus which is a really cool street named after the sailing scourge of the Americas. We were here the day the 49ers barely beat the Saints so there were crazies all over making noise and waving flags as they drove by. Pretty fun.
author: Miguel R.

description: My favorite pastry store in the area and a must go anytime I'm in the area asking with Golden Boy pizza! I usually get the original palmier and amaretto cookies! Cash only and no prices displayed though. Plenty of tables and chairss and two takes out front on the sidewalk.
author: Coy T.

description: We stop here as often as we can plus we bring friends here - great choice and super pastries, the pizza slices are a big hit as well. Highly recommend a visit.
author: Steven H.

description:
Holy moly cannoli!
Was walking by, craving something sweet..and being in North Beach, I just knew we were in the perfect vicinity of some phenomenal Italian tasty treats. Saw this neat lil spot while walking by and noticed a whole window decked out in pastries. Took two steps back and walked right in..my sweet tooth found its remedy!

Ordered up some cannoli's and within seconds, happiness coincided. Half chocolate dipped is the way to go. A bit on the pricey end, however, once the sweet deliciousness hits your taste buds, that won't matter anymore. The service was great, the gentleman working there was very welcoming and had a great sense of humor. I will most definitely return when I'm back in the area and try some of the other many delicious sweet tooth satiating delicacies in there!

ps- hit up the ATM, this place is cash only!
author: Akvile D.

description: Never Again!!!  We should have just gone to Stella's and saved time, money and a rude encounter!  Unfortunately, the service at Mara's was APPALLING!  We purchased over $65.00 worth of baked goods (cannoli, cream puffs, etc.), and it was a painful experience.  Mara's had two very miserable women working.  It proved difficult for them to answer a simple question...such as, "does this eclair have whipped cream or custard" - for crying out loud, so forget about a smile.  I don't think I've ever encountered such rude behavior.   Perhaps they should embark on a new career, like something out of the public eye.  Stella's was crowded, but the service is first class and their baked goods are actually better!  We purchased a St. Honoré  cake and the cookies that we wanted!  Oh!  They have eclairs with CUSTARD!!!!  Wished I would've have skipped the rude behavior and went there in the first place!!!  experience!
author: Bruno B.

description: This place should have nothing less than five.  Perfect coffees, perfect pasteries, Biscotti to go.  We were blown away with the Italian bakery.  Its perfect to go.  Walk right over to the Wadhinton Square  park at Union and Columbus.  Watching Tai Chi eating Italian pastries, a perfect San Francisco experience.
author: Beth H.

description: Cockroach sitting and exterminated by customers upon waking in. Didn't deter our family from ordering, though it should have. The 2 women serving behind counter were rude, indifferent and kept sneezing behind counter. Health inspector visit needed ASAP! Shame this happened. Visited here years ago and it was great. Will never be returning.
author: J S.

description:
I was lured in here by seeing a floor full of pastries stacked up on top of one another behind a glass window.  GOOD LAWD!  

So much to choose from...SO MUCH! Everything looked good.  Being that it was my first visit, I bought two: a Napolean and a pastry filled with custard, covered with chocolate.  

The Napolean was a blend of cream and wafers in between - and it was light, almost airy-like!  The pastry wasn't too sweet or too bland, it had the right balance of goodness. I was unbelievably at impressed how delicious it was!

The other pasty with the cream was eaten the next day. Not as great as I imagined only because it was a day old.  Bummer.  Note to self; if you buy their pastries, eat it right away. Otherwise, it just loses its magical powers!

OK,  the peeps behind the counter aren't very happy people  - whatevs. I'll still come back for more! 

Make sure to bring cash!
author: Diana M.

description:
Meh.

Authentic Italian guy behind the counter who was unfortunately pretty unfriendly. The coffee was terrible (tasted like Maxwell House or worse) and they charge for refills. Apparently "Mom" voted their cannolis the best for 42 years but she must have been on a keto diet with no baked goods whatsoever. They're fine, but I've had better. And $2.50? I'd have thrown it back except that I'm a bit afraid of the mob. So I ate it and stayed quiet. Till now anyway. Oops.

Other baked goods looked pretty nice. Might try if I'm back.
author: Grainne M.

description:
Service was good 
Latte was good

Beware .. cannoli had a stale shell.. (Probably not prepared fresh, almost freezer burned taste) but filling was ok.
author: Corey M.

description: I'm not am Italian pastry expert by any means. I don't frequent Italian restaurants often, because I'm usually disappointed. I honeymooned in Italy and loved the food there, so everything in the States pales in comparison. But I'm in town for a wedding and got some dim sum in Chinatown. I spotted this cafe as we walked back to our car, and my pregnant self suddenly HAD to have a cannoli. And then I HAD to have some coffee with it. Decaf, of course. Now I don't know if pregnancy makes me more picky, but lately I'll have a craving, eat it, and think it wasn't as good as expected. This was not the case here. I didn't expect much from the chocolate cannoli and decaf coffee, but it was heavenly. My husband gave me weird looks as I took a bite of cannoli, followed up with a sip of coffee, and sighed in bliss. Loved every bite and sip.
author: Cindy L.

description:
This place is so amazing. Delicious cannoli, eclairs, and all other kinds of pastries. I don't even know what to say other than that I can't fathom coming to North Beach and not coming here. Great coffee too. I'm posting a photo of their pastry case that pretty much says it all. 

A note of warning: One time I pointed at a cream horn and asked the guy at the counter for "that cannoli." He seemed insulted by my ignorance and brusquely shoved it at me and suggested I might like to eat at one of the tables *outside*. But to me that just gave the place more character, and it made a good story that I laugh about.
author: Michael B.

description: I am defin a fan of the cream puff however I used to come here years ago for the nepoleon but for some reason it doesnt taste the same anymore. Its a little pricey for what you get but the cream puff is a must!
author: Thuyvi M.

description:
Truly the best cannoli ever.  Leave the gun, take the cannoli !
Almost worth the trip from LA. to S.F.  Thank you Sharon for taking me there!
author: Vyvyan B.

description:
Ok, here's how this is going to go down. I'm gonna let you know that the food delicious items here are easily 5-star. Let's not get this twisted from the beginning. If I was simply basing this review on the food, it would be 5-star. Screw those that say "it's too sweet" or "there's too much butter" or it is too much anything. It's Italian Pastries...so, get with the program people. You think Italians are walking around going, "Do you have this in a glutten-free option?" or "Is there a sugar free option?" No. Because they love food. So there.

Here is the reason why Mara's had to lose two stars from their delicious 5-star worthy food:

#1 - they only take cash. Ok...really? I know that you have these methods of making delicious food that is all old school Italian. But you should not have your methods of old school extend to the entire business you run. How many times have I stopped in for a quick bite and then realize that you have no cash. And then you have to figure out if you want to find an ATM close by or use the one they have there which charges an additional fee. Can you seriously not take cards? Or get a Square account?

#2 - many a time, I've walked in and had the unfortunate luck to get the douche behind the counter. I love when it's one of the older people, because they're sweet and they're friendly and they'll usually chat you up. I like that. No, I very often get the younger folks who can't be bothered to help and don't offer any assistance until you have to yell at them that you're ready. And then when you do, they give you this look as if to say, "Excuse me? Are you coming into my place of employment and asking me for assistance? How. Dare. You."

So, if you can overcome these two obstacles, stop in for a delicious treat. It's worth it. Trust me. Seriously. Honestly. It is.
author: Nicolas H.

description: I've been walking past this store for years and finally decided to stop in and try a chocholate croissant. I wanted the pastry to be amazing, but it was just average. It tasted like it was a few days old and was too flaky for a croissant. Also, I know this is San Francisco, but $4.50 for a pastry is too much.
author: Scoot S.

description: I was lured in by the pastries in the window display and the charming older gentlemen reading the paper over coffee. I ordered a coffee and an eclair, my boyfriend ordered a cup of milk and a tiramisu- the total was over $16. Way overpriced and the pastries were not spectacular, certainly not $5-6 worth. Two stars because the man behind the counter is nice...but he doesn't use gloves or tongs to grab the pastries.
author: Ana I.

description: I've been going here for about 20 years. Used to go exclusively for the raspberry rings. Greasy as hell, but they taste amazing. Best I've ever had. Finally tried the cannoli today, and can easily say it is the best I have eaten in this city. "The tiramisu is magical" says an adorable little girl in a Doctor Who dress. Can't wait for tomorrow morning to try their biscotti for the first time.
author: Jubilee D.

description:
Horrible customer service...Nasty people.....
please don't waste your money by having latte there...it tastes nothing because all you have is hot milk....
i was so excited to have cannolies because they say they make the best ones, it was just a frustration...
please don;t spend your time and money for their products..Nothing special !!
Never reccommend nor will go back again !!!!!!!

Horrible!!!!
author: Bidik T.

description: My wife got a cheese danish and I got a couple of cannoli and brought it home for breakfast tomorrow morning. Well after dinner we were looking for something sweet to eat and decided to go for it. We each took a bite and my god. This is legitimately amazing pastry. It's like this is the ideal way to make these things. It was so good and delightful I immediately had to come on yelp and bookmark this place and tell everyone how good it is, because I'd fallen in love again.
author: Yoav G.

description: This place is outrageously overpriced and the quality of the pastry is only passable. I walked in yesterday and I bought a cannolo with custard and croissant with chocolate sprinkles. The ladies behind the counter were not particularly friendly and they were just there to clearly pay the bills. One of them put the pastry on a napkin in a precarious position over the glass that divides customers from employees, displaying her lack of training or attitude (you won't see that in an Italian bakery in Italy). The lady then proceeded to put the pastry in a white paper bag and when it was time to pay she told me that the total was $11 so I thought "HTF can 2 pieces of pastry cost $5.5 each?". The cannolo looked like a traditional cannolo from Piedmont which is extremely hard to find around the Bay Area because every bakery and everybody is so self absorbed into glorifying the cannolo from Sicily which is completely different and, in my opinion, a flamboyantly overrated pastry product (as you know, Italy does not have 20 regions but only one: Sicily). The cannolo had the right dimensions, shape and proportions but it was filled with way too much with custard. I had it this morning and I ate 3/4 of it. I threw away the rest of it because the amount of custard completely ruined the balance between the filling and the pastry (one thing Americans still didn't understand is that it's about the balance of the ingredients and not the quantity). Next to the cannolo with custard there was a cannolo filled with whipped cream which is a blasphemous aberration of the true cannolo from Piedmont. I suggest you don't get that: it's not nice to curse on other people's culinary traditions. All in all I doubt I will ever stop in Mara's Italian Bakery. If it was truly run by an Italian family had the business for generations I would have certainly noticed it since I know something about cannoli from Piedmont and I am quite familiar about a wide variety of pastries from many countries and cultures.
author: X. Y.

description: We split a piece of tiramisu and sat out on the shaded street. Great experience and wonderful tiramisu if that is what you are looking for. I don't know if I would recommend anything else here as nothing else looked appetizing.
author: Amanda W.

description:
If I could give this place ZEREO stars I would. My husband and I wanted to get a coffee and some pastries we found this place and thought it looked cute and tasty. Right when we walked in there were two employees sitting at a table in the corner while the other was behind the cashier helping someone else. I said down at a dirty table and finally someone got up to clean it. There aren't many tables inside it's a small place. My husband got a chai latte and a few other pastries. First the two women employees were so rude to him and talking about me in Spanish? I was just sitting at the table minding my own business. Then they plate the pastries and drop it in front of him and she places the cup in front of him at the cash register and just pours milk in the cup and adds something else and just left to there and both women went back to sit down with a fellow man and sit and talk gossip. They didn't bring it to the table or say anything they left tables dirty they talked about us and the place looked old there were flies in the dessert casses the food was dry, tasteless. We just got up and left he took one bite and couldn't take it. Funny thing is they didn't say anything and maybe 30-1 hr later we walked home and passed by and the table we sat at with our stuff was still there and they were still
Chatting away......
author: Brittni C.

description: And they're as kind as their pastries are delicious! Great location, right in the heart of Little Italy. Stop by for their oh-so-yummy cannoli!
author: Heather F.

description:
I didn't mind the canoli, I mean, it wasn't the best one I've ever had. Nor was it terrible. I guess middle of the road is best, though when you're in the little Italy section of S.F., you sort of have the bar set pretty high when it comes to something so sempatico like a canoli, you hear?

Still, I won't complain cause it would make a'momma sad, you hear. As for the prices, they're fairly fair. But who can complain, eh? 

Service on the other hand, it was just a'right. They box'a' your things for you - no problem. I guess i just had to get something good from Mara's Italian pastry while in the area. 

What can I say about this place other than it was just alright.
author: Javier J.

description:
This place has a ton of selection. I've here 2x and thought the pastries were just OK. 
However, i LOVED the nutella cappuccino even though I don't drink much coffee. I thought it was a great combination.
author: Grace C.

description: Try the one with almonds it has chocolate cake w orange flavored in it They call it a bear claw but it was the best tastin bear claw I have ever eaten. The service is not very friendly and the owner is a little strange but this is a great beakery and I recommend it very muc
author: David W.

description:
A stellar little gem is no more. 

We have enjoyed coming here through the years, however last time we came the pastry was day old and the Italian guy behind the counter was rude to every customer we saw. Would not recommend coming here again. Only highlight was the coffee and the charm of Little Italy.
author: Bo B.

description: My husband and I come to this bakery every time we visit the city. Mara's never disappoint's. This time we brought our kids. The kids loved it so much they eat everything we purchased to bring home. Making us go back before we left the city.  The place is definitely at MUST to visit and enjoy!!
author: Renee C.

description: We had the cannoli there it was pretty good. The building is old like most in the area. While most my think this my look bad I think it adds character.
author: Trent B.

description:
The pastry inside the window lure me in.
They advertise a deal of $7.5 which include 1 Danish, one cappuccino and one orange juice.  Not bad a deal.  The Danish is about average.
The other pastry is about $3.95 a piece.
Minus one star since I feel they did not like my business.
author: Kevin L.

description: The BEST cannoli's and pastries in North Beach! Cash only though so be prepared to splurge on your sweet tooth cravings!
author: Robert D.

description:
Probably receive hate mail a la david akers but whats so f'ng good bout maras?

This review primarily based on cannoli for just under 5bucks and i think they're shite and overrated.  Always assumed SF North Beach pastries in general were comparable if not better than Boston's North End, but not even close!  In value or taste

A front, facade, faux, phony, fake, sham
author: Clark G.

description: This is a reason to go to San Francisco. For real. It's so old school feeling and the cannoli, cheesecake and napoleons are to die for and the customer service is just fine. It's fun to snag one of the two tables out front and watch people oooh and ahhh at the piles of baked goodies in the front window. #LeaveTheGunTakeTheCannolis
author: Vivadc G.

description:
Disgusting place. I saw a cockroach crawling over the pizza near the window. The Spanish cashier just rolled her eyes and didn't even take action when I mentioned it . to her.  Never
Coming back. Management needs to address this ASAP.
author: Charlene C.

description: Came here by suggestion of my brother and his friends that live in the area. Excellent choice. The glass cases and windows were stuffed full of fine looking delicacies. I settled on a fruit puffed pastry and a mocha. My brain and stomach were completely overwhelmed and satisfied. My husband had a great conversation with owner about motor cycle racing and runs.
author: Rachelle Z.

description:
Walking along Columbus...how can you resist this window?!? Delicious looking pastries fill the window and call to me...so being as gracious as I am...I answered!!

Now before I was waited on, there was another customer ahead of me complaining about some order and they didn't seem to care what he was saying nor pay him too much mind.  It was almost as if they were telling him that there was nothing they could do.  Probably should of took a clue from that alone.

Like another reviewer had mentioned, there are no signs telling what the pastries are, or how much they cost.  And while the guy behind the counter was gracious enough to tell me what everything I inquired about was, I failed to ask him how much they cost. 

So my "pizza bread" and tiramisu ended up costing me about $7.  Too much to not have a memorable taste. Meh! =/
author: Ninja H.

description: A lot of people seem to like this place.  Its often full and the baked goods in the window sure look inviting.  But my pals and I tried a few different items and found that looks can be deceiving.  All three pastries may have looked great but they tasted just OK.  And by Ok I mean meh.  In other words so so, hum ho.  None of them were bad but next time, I'll try a different bakery.
author: Marcus K.

description:
My husband and I came in on a Saturday night and the place was busy. We ordered a cannoli and red velvet cake. The cake was odorless and tasted stale with a "previously-frozen" consistency. The cannoli had 2 lonely chocolate chips in it.  We ordered a cup of coffee and had to ask the staff to make a new pot (it was empty) and refill the creamer. The "fresh" coffee was bland and the place felt dirty.  The staff is apathetic.  

A better choice is Stella's or Cafe Greco.
author: Nikki H.

description:
Not impressed at all. Tudey service. Untasty treats. Well that might be too far of a knock, but not much flavor and taste coming through on the taste buds for the cannoli. I wouldn't go and I won't go back. Also if you have had cannoli's from Boston's North End, don't waste your money here. 

Word to the no cash carrying, get cash if you are coming here.
author: Ezra B.

description:
Whilst strolling amid the hustle and bustle of North Beach, my eyes happened upon a window full of delicious pastries!  I stopped cold in my tracks, causing a small pedestrian pile-up and eliciting a few "whatsamatterwithyou?"'s.  One particular pastry caught my eye...a ringed beauty, twisted and full of what looked to be strawberry, coated in a heavenly white glaze.

Into the shop I leapt, and in a twinkling I held the ring of power...er, deliciousness.  I sank my teeth into the contorted lovely and was overcome with joy.  So sweet; so tender.  I do not know thy proper moniker, but I will speak fondly of ye.
author: Greg S.

description:
I only come here for cannoli. they only take cash, and are vocal about that but the pastry is so good! Get the cannoli every t
Time and is the only food I never share. I don't leave little Italy without ending at maras!
author: Anne N.

description:
Had something that looked like an eclair and it was almost $5. I was shocked. Taste-wise it was a 3.5 of 5. 

I like that they have outdoor seating and it's right on Columbus so it makes for great people watching. 

The price was outrageous and therefore it doesn't get a 4.

You can't help but walk by this place and want to buy something. I love their tasty window displays (see pics).
author: Carlos A.

description: Came here on Easter Sunday for a drink and i really enjoyed my cappucino. Nice little spot. Service could be more friendly but overall, nice spot!
author: Maria H.

description:
Yummy cherry turnover.   Flakey buttery layers and just the right amount of tart, sweet cherry filling.  Choc covered cheesecake was the creamiest I've had.   Very nice.   Everything looked fresh and they were constantly bringing new items out even on a Sunday afternoon.   

Check it out!
author: Tad H.

description:
Whenever my friends and I are in North Beach, we always pay a visit to Mara's. I love Mara's because they have many types of coffee, they have good gelato that is cheaper than most of the other places on Columbus, and they have more baked goods than your big heart (or tiny tummy) could ever desire. 

Rarely is this place crowded, probably because many people end up stopping at the more expensive places along the way to Mara's (or at the Italian restaurants they were just eating in), so this place ends up being a little hidden gem. It's not a fancy place, and there isn't too much room to sit down and eat, so don't expect to bring a number of people and comfortable eat gelato and drink coffee. 

The service can be a little slow, even if there are only a couple of people at the store because the worker needs to switch off scooping gelato, making coffee, and handing out baked items, so be patient.
author: Shreya G.

description: Delicious!! Amazing variety and everyone was super friendly. Highly recommend if you are looking for a sweet Italian treat or a cup of coffee (recommend cafe mocha- best I've ever had) enjoy!
author: Hope D.

description: You can find me at Mara's pretty much every day of the week. That's why I also go to 24 Hour Fitness on a regular basis. Mara's is the real deal... Italian pastries and great espresso. I love sitting outside and hearing all of the tourists say "oh my God!" when they look at the pastries in the window. I also like the sign on the cash register that says "Hey! Cash only." Makes me laugh every time.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
4 words:

Best Effing Dessert Ever

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/eBwXYcyh_4C4xiKYCy1ygw?select=wMMFk5Rdo2y4BeS08_wIeQ

That is all.
author: Whitney B.

description:
Yummy!!! We just happened upon this place while walking around Russian Hill. Later I found out it was a really famous place?! Had the cannoli and espresso. OMG I will need to go back. Delicious!

Took off a star because the seating is kind of limited (we grabbed the last table), but it did seem like an authentic little Italian pastry vibe
author: Katrina F.

description: I feel completely ripped off. Because I was coming from a big dinner, all I wanted was a small bite for dessert, so I ordered a small cannoli. It was $4.50 (they don't list their prices)! Seriously--for a tiny cannoli. To make matters worse, when I bit into it, I found that it was completely hollow in the middle. The filling was only at the very ends. What a complete disappointment.
author: Paul O.

description:
Park if you can find it.  You might find parking 2 to 3 blocks away.

What can i say about this place?  Its awesome!  I love it.

Fine italian pastries and its in the North Beach area so if you want to walk around and hang out and people watch.  Come by here so you can get a nice taste of their cherry ring.  Which i've posted a picture.

This is more of a sweets kind of pastry.  Not like croissants or filled croissants.  

You can also get italian gelato here.

They have Canolli.  Its something everyone should try at least once.  There are so many things and you'll find at least ONE THING to your LIKING.  Enjoy!
author: Bing D.

description: Amazing customer service! The pastries were Devine! Truly a gift of San Fran!
author: Amanda W.

description:
[11/20/2011, 11:00am]

I am pretty surprised at all the positive reviews. Let me tell you our experience with Mara's. It was a Sunday morning. 11/20/11. We were leaving that afternoon for Washington DC after a nice weekend visit to San Francisco. Everything had been sublime...until Mara's.

The night before (11/19/11) we were walking along Columbus and saw the mouth-watering delicious looking display window. We had already eaten and were stuffed so we made a note to come by in the morning.

The next morning:
It's about 11:00am and we come into Mara's. We're starving and I can't wait to sink my teeth into a flaky, buttery pain au chocolat. We open the door. There's only one other person there, the owner, and the guy at the counter (first red flag). 

We look over at the display of pastries, which looks a lot like it did the night before (second red flag), and pick out a few including a nutella-filled croissant, which had chocolate sprinkles (third red flag). I also order a hot chocolate to stay. 

The guy behind the counter places the pastries we ordered on a few plates and goes to make my hot chocolate. He squirts an unknown syrup into a mug and pours some milk in, and warms it up. It's pretty cold when I get it. I taste it, not really what I expected for $4.00. I think it was probably some Hershey's syrup. 

Anyway, on to the pastries. I pick one up and bring it close to my mouth. No smell. No scent of fresh baked goodness, nothing. I bite into it. My teeth hardly make it through the hard shell. I force them down and manage a bite. It crumbles in my mouth and is stale, brittle and flavorless. Okay, maybe it's just that one. I move on to the next. Same story. I'm disgusted. We just spent $15 on three pastries and cold chocolate syrup milk? How has this establishment survived on serving old, stale and unappetizing pastries?

I could not believe it. As I searched my memory, I recognize that the focaccia and all the other pastries were the exact ones that had been there the night before. How dare they. And how could I have been so foolish. How did I not even notice that there was no kitchen or oven in the place? Duh. Some of their cakes/sweets resemble the ones at Costco.

I was so angry. Needless to say we left, and threw away the uneaten pastries. As another couple was about to walk in I warned them that the pastries were old and stale. They quickly turned around. I felt somewhat redeemed.

I still wanted a good pain au chocolat, so we walked up the street to La Boulange. http://www.yelp.com/biz/la-boulange-san-francisco-3
AMAZING. Highly recommend. We ordered the almond croissant, pain au chocolat, and a hot chocolate. A world of difference. Fresh, delicious, buttery, flaky, rich, quality chocolate. It was even cheaper. Go figure.
author: Michele E.

description: I was on the hunt for a cannoli in Little Italy when I found this place. The owner (who is from Italy) greeted us and was so friendly and sweet. I had a cannoli and spumone gelato and they were both delicious! I will definitely be stopping by here on my next trip to SF.
author: Lindsey B.

description:
The display window draws you inside the store.  I fell for it!

The pizza-looking breads has that "you must buy me" kind of feeling so I bought one, heated up, it tasted OK.  It tasted kind of dry but very savory and flavorful.. a tad of tomato sauce, olives, corn, green onions.. full of carbohydrates.. I ate only 3 bites and saved the rest.  

Prices are not that cheap.. I paid $3.25 or $3.75 for this. 

I saw a dessert selection too.. biscottis, cakes, cookies, and GELATO!

Maybe I'll try their gelato next time..
author: Tram N.

description:
Ah Mara's, a tiny little bakery in North Beach.

So I pass by this place while walking to another shop and make a note to come back.

Upon my return I see that there's a line out the door.  No worries, it's Sunday, I'll wait.  When my turn comes up I order 2 Chocolate cannolis, a napolean slice, a sfogliatelle and a cream puff stack.

The cannolis are very good and very rich.  If you were to compare them to Stella's, the filling is a bit heavier with less chocolate chips.  Stella's cannolis are always chock full of chips when I get them.

The napolean slice was dreamy.  I really love a good napolean and that's a pretty good napolean, not the best but still very good.

The Sfogliatelle I ate right when I got in the car.  It's really nice with the crisp layers and citrus flavored ricotta.  My only complaint is that the ricotta is a bit too dense and I felt clogged with cheese afterwards.  I much prefer lobster tails but I guess I'll have to wait for the next time I'm in New York. 

The cream puff stack had a pretty sugar glaze drizzled over the puffs which I thought was a nice touch.  But the filling I didn't like so much.  I was really hoping for a plain cream custard but this one tasted boozy and wrong.

So this place gets a solid 3 stars.  It's not the best place out there but it certainly isn't the worst.
author: Vicky C.

description: What a major disappointment! The window displays were enticing enough so tried several items. Everything was overpriced for the generally below-average quality and taste. The cannoli was average. The Napoleon and biscotti were both stale and tasted plain. The tiramisu however was the worst, too wet and fell apart too easily with bad taste. Don't let the window display fool you.
author: Mikey L.

description: We were in town staying across the street at the Stratford and every day we watched the crepes being made from our window. So we had to at least try them! I can't specifically comment because I'm gluten free but my wife and my kids devoured them like there was no tomorrow! All the food on the grill (hamburgers & hot dogs) and the fries, all looked exceptionally good and I'd go back to try more of it when I return to the city. The crepe maker was fun to talk to but the rest of the staff seemed uninterested and the eating area, mostly cozy counter that was plenty for an urban slot of a restaurant, needed some cleanup, while the floor also seemed a bit dirty for a restaurant. I don't usually notice the floor too much in places but it seemed unusually dirty (as was the bathroom), but then again, it is the city and I should not expect suburban standards :). I would recommend the food and I would return to try other menu items. Just make sure to watch the self described perfectionist of a crepe maker work her magic with the crepe mix!
author: Lee B.

description: DELICIOUS! I'd have to say it's a must if visiting the little Italy area. Stopped  by twice during by SF trip!
author: Edwin V.

description: This place is great if you are looking for a variety if Italian pastries. I got such pleasant service here I would not mind coming back if I were around the block. I wouldn't say they have fine pastries but you would find canolis, tiramisu, croissants, tarts and the likes.
author: Sara N.

description: Real deal, go with the cakes or moister desserts and you won't be disappointed! The owner's from Calabria (the tow of Italy) so you might get a little attitude, but that makes it even more authentic!  The location is perfect and everything is like in Italy; it's the quintessential authentic Italian pastry shop and it feels like a cozy hangout from the old country.
author: Terrence G.

description:
FANTASTICO!!

Mara's has some of the most delicious Italian pastries in North Beach!! I love coming here with friends and eating a pastry with a espresso :)
Besides sweets, there are also some pretty awesome focaccia bread pizzas...perfect for a mid-afternoon lunch! 

Yes, the place is very small, but I think it lends it a cozy, home feeling. Like your Italian best friend's grandma invited you over and you're sitting in her kitchen :)

Some of the items are kinda pricey (like the pumpkin pie, but then again that's probably what I get for ordering that at an Italian pastry shop -__-), but I think for the most part, it's worth it to indulge in some tasty Italian goodies!
author: Kei H.

description: I was walking by this place when the raspberry rings caught my eye.  I've never seen a pastry like that before and I was curious so I went in.  I looked over all their pastries, and though everything looked good, I still only wanted the raspberry ring.  The raspberry ring was really good.  In addition to raspberry, it has orange zest flavors to it.  It was very flaky.  Absolutely delicious.  I definitely want to come back to this shop the next time I am in SF.
author: Cindy T.

description: Tiramisu was delicious.  All the other goodies looked amazing too.  Someone else mentioned authentic unfriendly Italian guy and we got the same experience.  He actually was on his cell phone when we walked in and never got off his phone while he "served" us.  Certainly didn't feel like we mattered but the product was delicious.  Being cash only is also a negative considering the amount of tourists and visitors they get on a daily basis.
author: Paul S.

description: I had to give one star because I couldn't give any lower. Worst service I have ever had! Will never go back.
author: Rufus O.

description: They didnt have the cookies that I like today, which was ok, but I tried a new type that tasted and felt like they were topped with crushed stale candy canes.  (And they had sugar cookies shaped like snow men today... Are these frozen from Christmas or something?)  Also tried a biscotti that was pretty tasteless.  Add that to really crappy attitudes of the workers, and I'm taking my business elsewhere.
author: Christina W.

description: The only thing I tried was the biscotti.... and it was VERY GOOD..... even the next day. When coming to San Francisco my very first meal ALWAYS has to be dinner in North Beach..... And usually that dinner must be followed by something sweet. Well, crazy thing, but this time I was just too full to eat my sweet thing.  Of course I got it anyway, but knowing it wouldn't be eaten until the next day.... and that my hotel didn't have a fridge...... it would have to be something that would keep. Yay for biscotti! I got not one, not two, but THREE pieces (marble, anise, and almond chocolate chip). All of them were GREAT with my coffee the next morning, but the anise stood out as truly AMAZING!!
author: Jody G.

description: Unsanitary. We asked to try the gelato and the man re-used our spoons to scoop each flavor we wanted to try. That's disgusting!
author: Moni K.

description:
Years ago my boyfriend introduced me to this little adorable pastry shop in North Beach. He had been going here for years with his father to get the almond tart pastry. I must say, I too after having been introduced to this place, come here every so often to get the almond tart. It isn't like anything I have ever had from any other bakery. It is so delicious. I have a craving for it every few months. It is crunchy, moist and jammy in all the right places.

The other thing that I would like to mention, is that I am Sicilian. My Aunt makes the most delicious Italian cookies and pastries for every family get together. By far, Mara's is the closest I have ever come to my Aunt's Italian baking. 

I have only tried the cookies, almond tart and the canolli, but they shouldn't be missed. They are phenomenal and the best I have had in all the bay area. Nothing comes close. I love Mara's!!!!

If this place ever stopped doing business in the bay area, I would sincerely be heart broken.
author: Christina C.

description: Good but crazy expensive for what you get. $3 a pop for mini cannoli's. I have no issue spending money, but this is a ripoff.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Cannoli was not bad, but the almond croissant, and the other one which I bought (don't remember the name, but its shape was long and some slight sugar powder on it.) were horrible.
I expected too much fantasy of Italian pastry. Whenever I tried Italian bread in the city, was always failed! 
The custard in Cannoli's texture got on my nerves, and croissant does not have any of layers and also very thick. The taste was like, they don't use a good quality of butter at all, and too sweet.

The only nice thing is, their window display. Well done! I stopped and thought few times in one day, and finally purchased.
author: Ji Hye K.

description: Huge slice of chocolate cake, and cannoli that were both delicious! Will be back!
author: John G.

description: Absolutely delicious cannoli and tiramisu..  Best things my girlfriend and I have eaten all weekend!!! Highly authentic and recommended to everyone!
author: Patrick L.

description:
Love Mara's Tiramisu!!
I like my Tiramisu moist, but for some other people it might be too moist-y (like my friend). 
I like the window display showing all the pastries, it never failed to drag me in everytime I pass by. 
Everything I tried has been good so far.
author: Marlis T.

description: Cannoli is great, cream puff is great, tiramisu is great but yea, very overpriced - most desserts are about $5-7 each - though I guess they figured you just spent about $50 a person for a meal across the street, what's some pocket change? Yea, service is just serviceable but then the guy has probably just served 1,000 people that day so he could care less about you - it's a counter, just order and move on. :-)
author: Joe B.

description:
Destination spot whenever I'm in North Beach.  Oh my goodness (and I mean goodness) the raspberry ring pastry is to die for...yum, yum, yum.
All of the pastries I've ever eaten there have been divine.  
Sometimes the counter folk are grumpy, but it's probably because of all the people that come in there with their own ideas about how a pastry shop should operate! Who cares if the food is good?  did they not give you what you asked for?  then get over it people and grab a cannoli and move on!  
I wouldn't call this an "eat-in" cafe, it's just really a delicious pastry shop.
Won't leave North beach without something from Mara's!
P.S.:  CASH ONLY
author: Mary D.

description:
I have to admit the pastries look amazing and very tempting, however......
Coffee was not good. Mostly steamed milk. Asked for a single shot but got a single and charged for a double shot. Pastry was nothing special sort of stale not very fresh. To top it off I was almost shortchanged in a very sly way..if it wasn't for me double checking and doing my math I would have been jipped. Overall, avoid the temptation and try another place.
author: Gio F.

description:
Who doesnt like this place? Tonnes of sinful cakes and cookies to devour for your eyes and tummy. 

I did not know that this place sells Red Velvet cake slices until I walked in. The slice was huge, I had to share that. The cake was moist and the cream cheese, mmmm mmmm! 

Very small place, but if u sit on the booth, u will be able to eat ur sweet cakes and explore the store with ur eyes. The walls, the glass case, the window...very SWEET and tantalizing. Makes me happy!

Been here twice and i know i will be back soon!
author: Elly G.

description: I don't go in here much because I can't control myself.  The eclairs, cannoli, biscotti, cream puffs, cookies, napolean are all good.  My friend was in here two days in a row because she visited SF for two days.  It's not personal, the lady behind the counter treats everyone coldly.
author: t d.

description: Get the chocolate dipped apple fritter.  It's absurdly good.  Also a fan of their chocolate cannolis, but get the chocolate dipped apple fritter.  Seriously, what are you doing still reading this?  Go get it now.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Zak K.

description:
Cannoli with an evil eye.

Cannot dispute the quality of their cannoli. It's very good. And the entire dessert selection is quite impressive. But this is my third visit, and the third time I got the look and vibe like I was interrupting whatever it is they were doing behind the counter. Which I thought was selling me cannoli.

Two stars for having experienced better. Such as: http://www.yelp.com/biz/roamin-cannoli-san-francisco-2#hrid:N3LWH_wyR0_iQW7lw3Sj6Q
author: Jason B.

description:
I wish I could give this place negative stars.

I live right up the street from Maras and so pass it daily. I see people in there all the time, lured in by the admittedly delicious-looking array of pastries in the window, and it makes me so upset because I know this place lacks quality as much as honesty.

The pastries are old. The coffee and hot drinks are overpriced for not even being fresh (my friend went down there against my warnings, and told me he was charged $4 for a coffee that tasted like it was passed through used coffee grinds). And the people who own the place lie about everything. I went in one evening, understanding that bakeries usually don't bake anything fresh around 5pm, and when I asked the owner if he made everything that morning, he replied, "No, everything here is fresh. We put new stuff out every 20 minutes."

...

Every 20 minutes the two-man show bakes over a dozen different types of pastries and somehow gets them out on the shelves without anyone noticing? That stack of turnover thingies that looks the same as yesterday couldn't possibly be the same stack, right? Mara Pastries managed to bend the space-time continuum?!

Bullshit.

IF you are reading this, and you have the time and privilege of being able to look up where you eat, go SOMEWHERE ELSE. This is a tourist trap, and you are in little Italy, surrounded by wonderful pastry shops and cafes.

Go to Stella Pastry (Columbus) for pastries, and A.Cavalli Cafe (Stockton off of Columbus) for coffee/espresso drinks.
author: Jen N.

description: Just eh - both the pastries and the people behind the counter. There's not much to say other than that. Save your money and go somewhere else.
author: Jeffery L.

description: Had the tiramisu, macaroons, cannoli, and pistachio gelato. I will skip on the tiramisu next time, and have an extra scoop of the pistachio gelato. The cannoli was so good we ordered another one.
author: Jessica R.

description: Ugh tourist trap.  So I thought... it's Italian.  It should have a decent iced latte.  Wrong.  Super watered down mediocre coffee for $4.  Pass.
author: Jane K.

description:
All in all, I thought their pastries were very good.  We tried a couple of traditional pastries, and I particularly liked one whose name I didn't catch--it was a flaky ring studded with a cherry paste.  It flaky, crisp, fresh and extremely delicious.

We also tried an amaretto cookie, which was a bit gummy, but had a great flavor to it.  

All in all, definitely seems to be a quality place.  I'll definitely be going back next time I'm in the area and looking for a treat.
author: Brian F.

description:
This bakery charged me $3.50 for a stale almond croissant . The croissant was also too sweet. In short, the pastry was terrible.  You can get a better croissant elsewhere. 

In fact you can go to the better bakery across the street called Stella. They  make great tiramisu. I also love their Italian pastry. Next time I'll follow my instincts and go to Stella.
author: Claudia B.

description: Everything looked amazing. Tons of pastries. Sugar, chocolate, cream, biscotti, all look delicious.
author: Vince W.

description: Decent bakery, but super unfriendly guy at the counter. Your money will get you a couple of sweets (expensive) but dont expect to be treated as a customer.
author: Martin M.

description:
What a huge disappointment!

OK - I was having a great time in San Francisco, and I just had a great dinner at Cafe Delucchi.  I skipped dessert there, because while I was walking through Little Italy, I spied this great little bakery/cafe and decided I had to go back and eat my dessert HERE.  

After all, there was an Italian dude behind the counter talking with an old Italian dude, and they were speaking Italian.  In the back of the crowded cafe, was a table full of people speaking Italian.  There were only a few tables in there, and they were all occupied by people - speaking Italian.

So I said to myself, "this must be the REAL DEAL!"  

They had cases full of yummy looking baked goods.  I picked my favorite - Tiramisu.  I also ordered a Cappuccino, after all, I just had to sample real Italian coffee.

I was excited.  I didn't let the fact that the dude behind the counter was rather unfriendly and unhelpful.  I thought, maybe he's just into his conversation with the elderly fellow, and didn't want to work...

He went to making my cappuccino.  It was a nicely packed shot... it poured in the perfect time, it had great foam... "Wow!  I'm really excited to have come here," I thought to myself.

The tiramisu was wet, tasteless, and flat out sucked.  Worst thing that I've eaten in a while.  I didn't even finish it.  Considering how expensive it was - that's pretty weird for me.

The cappuccino was bad.  It was probably the worst cappuccino I ever had.  I didn't finish that either.

I spent around $10 for a stupid tiramisu and coffee, and I didn't even finish either.  

Maybe you could try their cannoli which is what their known for, I sure won't be back.
author: Anson G.

description: Oh my gosh. It's pricy but well worth it. Hands down BEST Italian pastries I've had in the city.
author: Laura D.

description: Canole's were all right. Coffee is fine. Not a huge fan considering the other options on the same street.
author: Anwar H.

description:
this place has the BEST!!!!  best! almond macaroons EVER!!!  they're all nice and chewy just like the ones i used to get back east.  and they're the perfect size.  and they're SO almondy.  their canoli's are the best you can get on the west coast.  so, they fill them ahead of time.  they're still good, not soggy.  and i also like their almond gelato.  i just had that today and it was DELICIOUS.

they have an awesome selection of italian pastries that are hard to get in california and the guy who owns the store is very charming and helpful.

this is the best italian bakery i've found outside of the tri-state area.  and their prices are very reasonable.

oh yeah, they don't except the card so you gotta bring cash.
author: lori s.

description:
To the guy who works there Saturday afternoons: GET A LIFE! You obviously hate your job, and think all the customers are lame. Well dude, you're the one doing something that you obviously despise. Suggestion: quit your job. Everyone will be better off. Thanks.

3 stars because the pastries that I had were pretty good, and it was entertaining seeing mr. douche-bag employee square off against  the  mr. "my grandmother was Italian so i'm mr. know-it-all" customer.
author: Sean B.

description:
I have to keep this review at 3 stars, for average, until I try more things here.  And believe it - I'll be back very soon!

Passed by here, craving for dessert after yet another Golden Boy Pizza late dinner.   To be honest, I wanted to hit up Caffe Roma, then Cafe Divine first, but they were both closed.

From the storefront, and interior, it appears to be a "hole-in-the-wall," authentic Italian pastry shop.  I can understand how some people might be 'weirded out' by the window display of pastries and foccaccia.  But, I have to say, it sure as heck stole (and kept) my attention!

Tonight, I actually felt a tinge of guilt having had GB Pizza for dinner *again* http://www.yelp.com/biz/PTFxtXS47ZVRCdZIrEWvGw 
(plus there was no way I could decide b/w one pastry or another!), so I opted for a single latte.   mmmm, it was a perfect latte for a perfect night.  I think there might have been some crack in it 'cuz I am seriously uncontrollably wired right now.

Nothing spectacular about the layout, but EVERYTHING looked wonderful to me - they have elegantly wrapped chocolates/candies displayed on the wall behind the counter.  They had Florentine cookies, profiteroles, tiramisu and the largest Palmier cookies I have ever seen (Also, the biscotti and chocolate cake were very tempting on this warm, late, vibrant night in North Beach).  Gelato served here, too.  Other yelpers say they're pretty generous with their servings!
